If these were the only problems I’d probably give 3.5 stars.HOWEVER, (this is going to be a ridiculously long story skip to the summary at the end if you want)maybe 5 months after I got it, the OS wouldn't boot. Just the X showing forever, restarting the bootloader didn't help. After calling and chatting, Asus agreed to take it back. They sent the RMA form, but no shipping label. Then I had to convince them to pay for shipping, and they caved reluctantly, said they would 'make an exception'.It takes them a month to turn it around. The confirmed that all they had to do was reinstall the OS, no hardware work, and it took a month. Fine. Whatever, it was working again.2 months later the OS stops working a different way. It keeps throwing up Android System errors more and more often, so I try a factory reset (standard fix) but it won't even get through the device setup because the system errors keep popping up and preventing it. So then I go through the same process as the first time - call, chat, RMA, chat again to get them to pay for shipping (this is Feb 10th) I send it back (note: perfect physical condition, just OS problems).After a couple of days I get the confirmation from FedEx that it has arrived at Asus in Texas. 5 days go by, I hear nothing and the RMA status online still says 'waiting' or something. I chat online, the guy says he'll flag it as urgent (which they already said they would before I sent it since it was the 2nd time it broke and I’ve already been without it for a month). Next day I get an email saying it's being shipped back unrepaired because it was received broken. They don't call me or email me to find out if I sent it that way or if it was broken during shipping.I get it back a couple days later and there are multiple cracks covering the whole screen. Maybe it broke during shipping, maybe the tech dropped it on the floor and let it sit there for 4 daysI call Asus and chat with them, and they tell me there’s nothing they can do because they received it broken. I already know that FedEx isn’t going to talk to me about it because I wasn’t ‘the shipper’.So then I file a complaint on Asus’ website (3/22). This is when I start documenting all of the ridiculousness.On 4/1 I started a chat since I had gotten no response, in the complaint system it still just said that it was “In progress”, like it had for the last 10 days since I filed it. They tell me that their system is down and they can’t look up anything.Mind you, Asus has set up their systems so you can’t contact anyone directly, so every time I contact them I have to tell them the whole story or tell them to go look up my file then wait 5 minutes (ignoring the initial message it sends at the beginning: “Hello Andrew Stevens, thank you for contacting ASUS support. Please give me a few moments to review your information. I will be with you shortly.” and I wait 5 minutes and they know nothing about my case).So I suggest that they contact me when their system is back up. He says that’s a great idea. Guess what, they don’t. I chat the next day, 4/2, their system is back up.They train these people to be closers. Not customer service. They say whatever they need to get out of the current chat session and on to the next one.In this chat session then on 4/3, 4/4, they tell me they’ll escalate the case, they’ll have their supervisor call me and they’re very sorry but Asus doesn’t do replacements and there’s nothing they can do. I don’t get any calls, no help at all. They also tell me I should file a claim with FedEx. I tell them I already did (repeatedly) but FedEx told me (as I expected) that they would have to deal with Asus for the case since they were the shipper. The Asus rep finally tells me that the shipping claim will be handled by ‘someone at corporate’ and he can’t give me a phone number, can’t check on the status for me, and can’t tell me what’s going to happen.Also on 4/4 they finally respond to my original complaint:“I apologize for the issues you are facing. As Nigel had explained we had received thetablet with physical damage that was not reported to us in the inital contact whenrequesting an rma for your tablet therefore we had returned the tablet unrepaired toyou.”and that’s all….no help at allFinally on 4/7 they call me (outside of the hours that I told them I’d be available, with no call back number) and tell me (once again) they can’t do replacements so I should send it back in and they’ll request to replace it. They don’t tell me they’ll email me the RMA form or a shipping label, they just leave it at ‘send it back in’.So I chat again on 4/8, I didn’t have to convince them to give me a label this time, but I did have to ask for it.I send it in, they receive it on 4/15.I get a call on 4/22 saying the motherboard and screen have been replaced, and they want me to pay for return shipping. So I don’t care at this point, I’ll pay the $7 or whatever.It’s now 4/25 and they still haven’t sent me the form to provide my payment information for shipping. So who knows when I’ll get it back and if it’ll actually work then.SUMMARY:DON’T BUY ANYTHING FROM ASUS

Reviews.Title: Great tablets for surfing or watching video
Reviews.Author: jdickey
Reviews.Content: I use this primarily for watching Netflix or HBO go. My daughter uses it to play games. I also sometimes use it for surfing or Facebook. It works great for all the above. I like the weight and size better than my full-size iPad for a tablet. The battery life is not awesome, so that's why I took off one star. I have to recharge it after just a few hours use and - worse - it dies pretty quickly even when I'm not using it and even when I have it fully powered off. Still nice to have around though if you can get into the habit of charging it very regularly.

Reviews.Title: Snappy
Reviews.Author: Robbin Louise Reams
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous tablet at an unbeatable price. The display is gorgeous and it responds very snappy. It handles games well too.

Reviews.Title: Performs Great  Looks Great
Reviews.Author: Rebecca Murfin "beckymom"
Reviews.Content: This compact tablet was purchased with the leather cover.  It has almost all the features of the bigger I Pads.  It does not have a camera for taking "photos" only selfies.  It's handy book size makes it easy to take along.  It was a gift so I would definitely look at again if another gift is in order.

Reviews.Title: Good when it works- but that's not for very long!
Reviews.Author: Construction pro
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet for exactly one year and I regret ever buying it. I have been very gentle with it and never damaged it. However, I have had to send it to Texas 3, yes that's right, 3 times for warranty service. Twice I had to pay shipping to get it there - about $30 worth. The first time they had to replace a defective gyroscope- it suddenly stopped rotating the screen. The second time it would continually try to reboot itself. A complete reset would not fix the problem. They sent it back saying nothing was found defective, but they obviously reloaded the software because it worked when it came back- for about 1 month. Then it broke down the third time. It just suddenly tried to reboot itself and wouldn't quit with the little swirling colored circles on the screen. It would not even let me complete a factory reset and it stopped even turning itself on. Each time it breaks down, you have to send the thing to Texas for service. They keep it for over a week after they receive it, before they ship it back to you. When they do ship it back, it is Fedex, and if you are not home all day to sign for it you have to go to Fedex to pick it up- a 1/2hour drive each way for me. The total turn around time each repair is about 3 weeks from the time you ship it out until it arrives back at your local Fedex. In one year I have lost all my data 3 times, have been without a tablet for 9 weeks total, and now I am awaiting it being shipped back to me the final time. The thing is, my warranty expired during the time they were working on it, so next time it dies on me- that's it, I'm out my time, money, and data. Really horrible way to treat an Asus customer! I have an Asus desktop and 2 first gen Nexus 7's and a second gen Nexus 7. I doubt I will buy another Asus product. Beware! By comparison, I had a Bosch circular saw that died after a year and a half of light use. It was out of warranty, however Bosch fixed it free of charge and I got it back in exactly 1 week from the day I dropped it at UPS to go to Atlanta. Asus needs to take a lesson from Bosch on how to do customer service. Asus, you have lost my loyalty and my business.

Reviews.Title: Why Google, why?
Reviews.Author: C-bog
Reviews.Content: I'm getting really, REALLY annoyed with this device.  Bought it from Office Depot about a year ago and it has been nothing but power problems.When the thing actually turns on, it works as expected -- like a slower version of my Samsung Galaxy S4, but with a bigger screen.  I guess that merits the star.But the biggest issue is that if you do not plug this device in EVERY SINGLE DAY and you commit the sin of letting the battery drain then you are in for a world of frustration.  Google's website has these "fixes" for that issue, but it only fixes the issue that one time.  If the battery ever drains again, then you need to spend a half an hour doing the following:1)  Plug Nexus 7 in.  Watch the blank screen while it does not register that you have anything plugged in.2)  Press the power + the volume down button.  Watch the blank screen while it does not go to the bootloader menu.3)  Repeat steps 1 and 2 for half an hour.  At this point, you may end up giving up.  Try again tomorrow when the frustration wears off.4)  Finally get to the bootloader menu and choose "power off."  Watch the device power off.5)  Watch as your device finally charges.  Four hours later, your device might turn on.Doesn't that sound exhausting?  Well it is.  Every....single....time.You'd better keep a plug that powers the Nexus 7 in your pocket at all times since if it runs out of battery may God have mercy on your soul.  Oh and did I mention that not all micro-USB plugs are compatible with the Nexus 7?  Sure, they plug into the device, but unless you are using the one that came with the damn thing, you'll never know if it is just the plug, or if you ran out of batteries.

Reviews.Title: what a toy
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Karen"
Reviews.Content: I love this Nexus. It's so easy to learn. My daughter-in-law owns one and we played with hers all day, then I ordered mine. I'm using it  mainly for books but rest is fun too. The only thing I can really complain about is that outside in bright daylight, it's almost impossible to read because the screen doesn't light up for books when it's bright. The screen however does light up in dim and dark areas.  I don't understand this because all the other programs and apps light up in sunlight and it's very clear.All in all,  I definitely  would recommend this Nexus 7 because the price is right and the ease of use (which is a big one for me).

Reviews.Title: BUYER BEWARE!!!!  RETURNING FOR 4TH TIME!
Reviews.Author: ringer
Reviews.Content: Shame on you Asus!!!  Returning my Nexus 7 for the 4th time!  Since 2 months after purchase tablet has randomly shut down, refused to power up, then randomly turned itself on to shut itself right back down.  Has been returned to ASUS 3 times for repair...  The first repair worked for exactly 1 hour (after a several week wait for it's return). Is now going back for the 4th time and I had to FIGHT, THREATEN and Yell to get them to take it under warranty.  Asus claimed that the 12month warrantee on the unit I purchased 10 months ago is expired.  After threats and yelling they did agree to make the repair one more time under the warrantee... So at least I know that several weeks from now I should get about 1 more hour out of my $300 tablet!!!  Absolutely DISGUSTED with this product and the Customer Service!!!***Should they make good this time and replace the defective unit I paid good money for I will update this review.  Should it not be updated, be assured that they failed me.

Reviews.Title: Great Value for the Price
Reviews.Author: Robert Radenheimer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this for my 10 year old daughter.  She absolutely loves this tablet, and takes it everywhere.  She easily connects it to the hotspot on her phone and has interent everywhere.

Reviews.Title: better than i expected
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use as a pdf reader, specifically, but it has surpassed my needs. I mainly use it for watching youtube in bed now, as the screen is incredibly crisp and bright. There is a surprising ubiquity to this miniature tablet, with it's speed and clarity. If you need a device for gaming pdfs, porn and email, this tiny monolith is your Excalibur.

Reviews.Title: Google Nexus 7 vs. Ipad Mini
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Jon Smith"
Reviews.Content: I have both the Ipad Mini and the Google Nexus 7.  The Nexus screen is much better.  I tried wifi for both at six different locations in Chicago, four with relatively weak signals.  Both work fine with a strong signal.  The Ipad Mini picked up on all weak signals.  The Nexus 7 picked up none, a real disappointment.  Also the screen touch and scrolling smoothness for the Nexus 7 is not quite as good as that for the Ipad Mini.  In all, the problems for the Nexus 7 were a deal-breaker.  I returned it for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Good Small Tablet Now Replaced By Nexus 7 FHD
Reviews.Author: Alan  Houston
Reviews.Content: The Nexus 7 is one of the best small tablets, providing performance equal to the best Samsung models at a better price.  The lack of an SD card slot makes the 32gb version essential for people who want to store lots of movies and music.Tablets are fragile so keep your Nexus 7 in a case that protects the screen.The new Nexus 7 FHD is already available, with a sharper screen and improved wi-fi performance.  Some vendors will continue to ship the old version.  Be sure to clarify which version you are buying as the older version should sell for a much lower price.

Reviews.Title: Great for books or watching movies
Reviews.Author: Michael A. Silver
Reviews.Content: The Nexus 7 isn't perfect, but it's still a great device.First the good.I love reading on it and watching movies and most apps are generally more fun and easier to use (due to the larger screen) than on a android phone.  One of the reasons book reading is so pleasant is the high resolution screen.  The text is very clear and sharp.  I would probably buy another Nexus device just for that fact.  These also are the first to get new iterations of the android operation system directly from Google.  Contrary to others, I prefer the large edges as it's easier to hold while reading or watching a movie.  The multiple user interface is simply fantastic.  All 4 people in my family use the same tablet and it's like we all have out own.  This is amazing feature.  Battery life is decent and with moderate use lasts a few days.Now the bad.The device slows to a crawl when installing or upgrading apps.  It's not a huge problem since it's not a common occurrence (at least for me).  The corner of the screen cracked on mine and now the software buttons only work sporadically.  While the crack was probably my fault, my kids ipods have hundreds of cracks and still work more reliably.  A replacement screen costs more than the device.  On rare occasions there is a huge slow down and the device is unresponsive for several seconds.  Sound could be louder.  Why the speaker isn't on the front of the device, escapes me.  Overall the device isn't as responsive (but very close) to my Nexus 4.

Reviews.Title: Just plain-WOW!
Reviews.Author: Bobby
Reviews.Content: This little gizmo is impressive. Everything is well thought out and easy to use. The screen is bright and very clear. It's super fast. I was amazed that this little 7" tablet is quad-core. The only previous experience was my iPad 2, which I still have and use. I find myself grabbing this Nexus 7 because of its size and speed. Great product.

Reviews.Title: Everything it says it is
Reviews.Author: TheNewMrs.
Reviews.Content: If you want to go spend the money on an iPad, go for it. This is NOT an iPad and shouldn't be compared. But it IS what it says it is and has done great for us so far. Really decent battery life, quick processor, good wi-fi antennae, nice size, decent GPS pick-up (with wi-fi and then after) and with all soft-buttons, you can rotate in any direction (which is nice when you're trying to recharge and still play a game). Love the size and weight too!

Reviews.Title: Reliable tablet with a few major problems
Reviews.Author: LonghornTech
Reviews.Content: The Nexus 7 is a solid all around tablet running on Android's latest OS. The OS itself is intuitive and well presented. The Nexus' hardware feels nice, with a rubbery backing and solid "one piece" feeling design. Where the design fails is silver framing around the screen which is made of cheap plastic. Besides the frame, the tablet is made of premium materials (as premium as the price allows). Performance is good, size, weigh, and feel are also very good.My main problems are: WIFI connectivity is weak. Battery life is very short (drains when idle, usually only lasts me 2 days). Charging takes a very long time. Screen is so-so (not so great in bright sunlight). front facing web-cam is poor. no back camera. No ports or card slots (for this price, that's OK)Would I recommend at this price? Not anymore. Competition is better than what it was when the Nexus 7 was released. I would pick up a Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 7 inch (10 inch is only 50-100$ more than Nexus) or wait for the 3 iterations of the Galaxy Tab 3. That being said, I would definitely recommend over the Kindle Fire (sorry Amazon) and Nook if only for the pure Android experience. If you have time, be on the lookout for upcoming Windows RT devices as well. Hope this quick review helped!

Reviews.Title: Excellent OS experience and mostly good HW experience
Reviews.Author: Matt Martin
Reviews.Content: I picked this up to replace a Kindle Fire (Gen 1) that my son somehow misplaced.  I really like having a tablet around to take care of info lookups or quick tasks when not near a computer.  Love the unlimited/unlocked Android OS vs, the custom Fire OS.  I get why Amazon did that and for many, that doesn't matter.  It's nice though for me to have basically identical experiences on phone and tablet and that's what I have now with this Nexus and the Droid Razr.  HW gets a slide dock.  Apparently there is a cable that connects the battery that can come loose easier than it should.  This is what happened to me.  With some research, I was able to ply it apart and fix the issue just fine but the fact that it is susceptible to it was annoying.  The design is slim but it feels a little more flimsy compared to the Kinder Fire I had.  I could not compare to the Kindle Fire HD to know how the screens look but I don't feel I'm lacking with the Nexus.  I bought mine refurbished so not quite the $200 new.  If you want a truly open tablet experience for Android and you can find these on a good deal, I'd highly recommend picking one up.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: John Woods
Reviews.Content: After trying a Se7e, and deciding I needed more performance than it offered, I ordered one of these.Display quality: 5/5Weight: 4/5Battery life: 5/5System memory: 5/5System storage: 3/5Built-in software: 5/5Shipping/Delivery: 5/5Total:  4.6/5Pros:Fast. Crazy fast. CPU, GPU, system memory, storage, LAN access. These are what make the experience of using the Nexus 7.Plenty of built-in storage. The 16GB the unit came with was enough for all of my apps, and a fair amount of music.Display. Gorgeous. With the 8-core GPU, everything is smooth and fast.Best Android keyboards I've used yet, though I don't know how much that really says.Cons:No MicroSD card slot is pretty silly and potentially very annoying. A lot of my stuff should be running off of the MicroSD.Boot time seems slow for what the unit is, but I can't claim to know which Android features are the biggest slowdown.On my 2.3 phone and my old 4.1 phone, I could switch from Swype to typing constantly and not have any problems. The Nexus 7 seems to want to switch with whatever you've been doing. If you type a word, then try and swipe one, it'll just type the first character.I consider tablets to be useful only if you can move around and quickly bounce between applications. The Nexus 7 delivers in style. Fantastic work, Asus.My suggestions:Add a Micro SD slot.Overall:Buy it.-John

Reviews.Title: Wonderful entry-level tablet
Reviews.Author: Haaron
Reviews.Content: I purchased this product a couple months ago (not from Amazon, as I am currently devoid of credit card), and I am mostly satisfied with the purchase.  The lack of a rear-facing camera tends to be trying at times.  I would love to be able to take pictures with it, and utilize augmented reality when GeoCaching - the apps simply won't be available in the play store.Battery life is amazing.  Despite the design flaw involving zero-level battery (the unit will refuse to power on or charge unless you physically remove the battery connector from the main-board and re connect it), it is very well equipped and designed.The form factor is wonderful - even with a leather protective envelope-case it fits rather nicely in most pockets (inside coat pocket, back pocket in deep pocket pants etc.).The CPU and graphics engines are both very powerful.  Gaming - even 3d gaming, while extremely draining on the battery - are very fluid and perform flawlessly.  The image quality when displaying pictures and watching videos are above par.  There are reviews out there stating that graphics tend to be blocky and pixelated on this tab, but I have not run across this problem.  Touch screen is quick, sensitive and very responsive.I have not run across a better tablet for the money.  I use mine for work, play and everything in between.The only major complaint I would have (aside from the aforementioned zero-charge glitch) is the apparent fragility of the unit.  While I have not had any problems myself, this is mostly due to the level of care I take with all my electronic devices.  This is not a tablet I would recommend for a child without respect for the device (my kids have asked me to use it about a thousand times and counting).ASUS builds a quality product, and I was surprised to discover the charging issue.  Everything else they have built has performed flawlessly for me.It is worth noting that my first attempt at purchasing this device rendered a DOA (Dead On Arrival).  This was immediately returned to the store for an RMA with no hassles.  The rep then got another, and powered it up in front of me.  Happy ever since.

Reviews.Title: Would not purchase
Reviews.Author: Joey D
Reviews.Content: When this tablet is working, it's ok.  One complaint that I have is that the volume is horrible.  It really can't get loud at all.  I bought the tablet to keep my kid entertained on a plane but you can't even hear it inside the plane.  My other issues are that it often won't turn on at all.  If you research online, you will see that this is a very common complaint.  In addition, there are definitely issues with the battery.  I can fully charge it (which often takes a complete day for some reason), turn it completely off, and then it somehow will lose power because when I go to turn it on, it's dead.I realize that my item may be defective but, again, look elsewhere other than the reviews that you see here because my problems are far from unusual.  I decided on buying this tablet after reading all of the wonderful reviews on here.  I have not attempted to send it back to ASUS and the reason for that is a prior horrible experience when I sent my ASUS laptop back to them for warranty service.  To make a long story short, they lost my laptop for several weeks, would not speak to me on the phone, hung up on me, refused to call me back, etc.  It wasn't until I told them I was a lawyer and I would sue them that I could get a supervisor to speak to me.  After that experience, which happened after I bought this tablet unfortunately (otherwise I never would've bought the tablet had I went through that before buying the tablet), there is no way that I would ever send anything to ASUS because I have no idea if I will ever see it again.Do not buy!

Reviews.Title: Do not waste your money on this trash.
Reviews.Author: Matt Wilson
Reviews.Content: I have owned this tablet for less than a year now. A few months after purchasing it, the device began to suffer from notably sluggish performance. Yesterday, it died completely and will no longer power on. I'm left with an overpriced paperweight.After some reading, I've discovered this is a common problem with users who bought this tablet when it hit the market. To my knowledge, this hasn't been repaired. Stay away from this device. It's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great Device
Reviews.Author: Dwayne
Reviews.Content: I bought the 7 for it's portability.  I already had a Gen 1 iPad, but wanted to try Android tablets that weren't too expensive.Performance was exactly as advertised.  Very responsive with it's 4 core CPU and 1GB SDRAM.  I came with a couple of nice apps, but nothing special.The reason it didn't give it 5 stars were minor technical issues: 1) the usb cable that came with it didn't fit snuggly into the charger base.  I replace the cable and no problems.  2)  The wi-fi is not as good as my Gen 1 iPad.  The nexus would drop connection and my iPad stayed connected when I was comparing apps.  I even swapped positions on the table top to see if it were location.  The antenna must be in the back near the top, I lose signal sometimes when I hold toward the top.  However, moving closer to my access point fixes this.Otherwise, it is a great device.

Reviews.Title: Great product at a great price!
Reviews.Author: Masterofenergy "Jenna"
Reviews.Content: Got it for my 15 year old daughter and she uses it often. It has a big enough screen for her to do all the things she loves and I have not seen any issues with speed. Seems to work just like a good android phone with a big enough screen to watch movies and videos comfortably.

Reviews.Title: starts good but becomes terrible
Reviews.Author: sam
Reviews.Content: I'm about ready to get rid of my nexus 7 for a much better tablet. I've had the nexus 7 8gb for about a year now. First of all 8gb isn't even enough space for the apps let alone music, videos, or anything else. So if you must buy this tablet go straight for the 32gb. I think even 16gb is too little for most peoples needs.Now about the Nexus 7. When I first got it 8 loved it. Asus did a great job manufacturing it. Its very light weight while not feeling like a toy. I've dropped it a few times on concrete and theres only one small scratch on the edges, and its only a dot. Its definitely made well. Out of the box the things as fast as it needs to be. Its been great until a few months ago when it started to get really slow. I tried checking different apps and even gave it a hard reset. Its still slow and its gotten slower, and I'm experiencing several bugs.I really like android and I like how the nexus 7 looks and feels. However, this tablet is just full of bugs and Google's customer service has been terrible for me.I did like the tablet a lot when I first got it. However its just becoming too hard to use with the lag. I do understand that its the first generation and there'll be a few bugs. But I never thought it would be this bad. Wait for the 2nd gen nexus 7

Reviews.Title: GOOGLE NEXUS 7 TABLET
Reviews.Author: victor anaya
Reviews.Content: THE TABLET IS EXCELLENT, VERY FAST AND VERY COMFORTABLE. IS A GREAT CHOICE AND HAS VERY GOOD DEFINITION ITS GREAT

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Lars
Reviews.Content: great cross between a tablet and an e-reader. Great for fans on amazon and Google. being able to sync both kindle and Google play with other devices and Google drive.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Choice
Reviews.Author: Maggie Franco
Reviews.Content: Just received my Nexus 7. I am amazed by the quality, performance, speed.  I am so glad I didn't spend the $150 more in a mini, if you know what I mean..

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: C Mac
Reviews.Content: This ubiquitous tablet is very handy and can't beat it for the price. I switched from the Playbook and the tegra 3 makes a world of difference. Screen is responsive as well c/w playbook and Lenovo a2109.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: John Kilcoyne
Reviews.Content: I just love this tablet and it's so fast and the screen is just beautiful, it has met and exceeded all my needs.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7 is Fine
Reviews.Author: John B.
Reviews.Content: Although still learning to live in the "apps" world, I am enjoying the flexibility and wide-ranging possibilities of the Nexus 7.  Work on documents is very significantly improved by the addition of a keyboard -- Logitech preferred.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product
Reviews.Author: NORMAN TATE BONINO
Reviews.Content: I love this, the user experience is perfect, quickly response and easy configuration. EXCELLENT, The best in the market, and the size... mmm DON'T THINK MORE YOU MUST HAVE ONE!!!

Reviews.Title: My son loves it
Reviews.Author: Happy Homesteader
Reviews.Content: This is a great, less expensive alternative to the iPad.  There are plenty of apps available and it's easy to connect to the internet with the wi-fi.  We did have an issue with it not charging after it completely died but a quick google search helped us solve that problem.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful gadget for my parents
Reviews.Author: Tarjan
Reviews.Content: This is my first android experience as I am an apple freak. I have ipad, ipode, iphone but couldn't resist for having one nexus tablet.This is really promising and hence I gifted to parents as it is easy to operate.

Reviews.Title: The best 7" Android tablet out there right now.
Reviews.Author: Jameson
Reviews.Content: Reading, music, movies, games, business, pleasure you name it. A device that I simply can't live without anymore. Shipped quickly and works fine.

Reviews.Title: Unique tablet!
Reviews.Author: Lian Hao
Reviews.Content: If compare Apple IPad and Samsung tablet saw everywhere, Google Nexus 7 is very different and unique. That's what I want and like!

Reviews.Title: nexus
Reviews.Author: michelle
Reviews.Content: Wonderful product. I love love love love this tablet. My grandson uses it for his games. thank you again. wonderful

Reviews.Title: Best purchase ever
Reviews.Author: jason
Reviews.Content: Besides not having a back camera i love this tabletFor the price i couldnt have asked for anything better.It does everything i need it to whether i'm at school or just killing time at home.I love how it links to google play on the google site. i'm not sure if if does that for other android devices but i love it nonetheless.Used it for about a week now with no problems no complaints.

Reviews.Title: Great!
Reviews.Author: Zack Holloway
Reviews.Content: Wonderful tablet that gives great bang for the buck. Better size than an iPad, I can hold it with one hand, and better for reading as well as on-the-go

Reviews.Title: I love the tab
Reviews.Author: Hooi Ling Lim
Reviews.Content: I love the tab. Works well using wifi. The resolution is clear but not as sharp as ipad or samsung galaxy S3.

Reviews.Title: perfect tablet for our purposes
Reviews.Author: TechMom
Reviews.Content: We love this tablet. No complaints. My kids are the primary users. It is holding up very well to my toddler's daily use. (We did buy the MoKo Slim-fit case for it, which I highly recommend.) :)

Reviews.Title: It just works!
Reviews.Author: asdf1234
Reviews.Content: I have had lots of different computers (and that is what this thing is) over the years.  They all required various bits of tinkering to get them to work the way I want.  In the past, this was part of the fun.  These days, I want things to just work without a hassle.  The Nexus 7 delivers for that requirement.I do have to say that I did have one issue.  With one of the software updates a while back NFC (Near Field Communications) started using a LOT of battery power.  I just disabled it as I don't use the feature.Outside of the NFC issue, the battery life is great.  The screen is excellent.There are two things missing from the Nexus 7:A rear facing camera, but that is expected at this price point.SD (or micro SD) card slot.  I see no excuse for this.  Cost would have been minimal and I'm sure space could have been found.  That said, so far, the 16GB has been enough space, but I don't store music of videos on it.

Reviews.Title: Way better than any ipad!
Reviews.Author: CameraGuy
Reviews.Content: This tablet is amazing!  I ended up giving the ipad to my grandma and am now an android fan for life!Buy this tablet, you won't regret it!!!

Reviews.Title: the best tablet that i have ever get in my hall life
Reviews.Author: hamed saleh
Reviews.Content: Well I never ever regret even one moment that I bought this awesome tabletI'm a big fan of Asus and Google and I can surely tell that they did really a great jop with the nexus tabletEvery aspect of the tablet is amazing and Asus and Google made this tablet perfectThe screen : the most beautiful thing in this tablet so vivid so clear so fully colorful and del ever a huge details of any picture you want , of course Asus is very good in making monitors and they did really a good hop with this screenThe processor : so blazing fast so awesome of course the tegra 3 processor is very good at compiling games so if you are a gamer then this is your tabletThe size : very awesome it can fit my hand immediately and feeling no problem with it , my friends liked it and One of them considering to buy for himself a one awesome nexus tablet .The price : the miracle of the tablet soooo cheap for this impressive deviceAlmost everyone now can buy n awesome tablet thanks Google for aiming thatFrom the begening  .The cons :Actually there is not so much cons there is a one small con that I don't like about the tablet that the WiFi sometimes don't get connect immediately especially if the battery is low but but 90% of the times I try to connect with internet it connects immediately and I think the problem is not from the tablet I think its from the modem itselfConclusion :This device is worth not every penny you spend it worth more .

Reviews.Title: Almost Flawless
Reviews.Author: Timothy Lawless
Reviews.Content: You can read reviews all over that tell you the technical abilities of the Nexus 7 but I can tell you that this tablet is a productivity powerhouse. I attended 4 classes online, wrote 2, 6-page papers and commented on 6 discussion questions all using the voice recognition keyboard. Very little editing. The voice typing seems to work better if your typing into a Google Doc, then go and cut n paste where the text belongs. I was looking for a tablet that could replace my notebook computer and the Nexus 7 has done it.The only flaw in the whole device is that it only has 1 usb port. Sucks when you want to charge and hook up the hdmi adapter at the same time. I did test typing with a USB keyboard using the OTG cable and that worked flawlessly.The battery life in the Wi-Fi version is amazing. Getting about 10 to 12 hours screen time. Only about 4 hours playing Grand Theft Auto but you got to figure that burns up some cpu power.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Buy!
Reviews.Author: Dks216
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the 16GB Google Nexus 7 from the Google Play Store. I was looking for a cheaper alternative to the iPad and to upgrade my Kindle. No regrets with this purchase! So far, this tablet has lived up to the hype:*Access to all Google products (i.e. Chrome, Talk, Wallet, Google +, etc)*Access to plenty of free Apps through Google Play Store.*Complimentary music and magazine samples.*Front-facing camera.*Light-weight, durable, good color quality*Price-point: Around $200*32GB model available - with or without phone carrier service.I would highly recommend this product to anyone who is seeking a less expensive alternative to the iPad or similar device.

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good for my first entry
Reviews.Author: dnoyeB
Reviews.Content: I have had my tabled about two weeks now. I bought it mainly to replace my nook that BN decided to destroy with a bad patch.  In addition, it allows me to read at night.  Plus it does everything else my phone already does.I have learned that the answer to the question of it being big enough for comfortable web page reading is...Almost.  I would probably be at home with a 10" for reading web pages.  But for Facebook and for you tube and other videos, this is great!  I also use it to take notes at work.The only flaw I have see is that it seems to have an old generation or old technology LCD display.  It appears to 'ghost' like LCDs did when they first entered the computer arena several years back.  So it is very uncomfortable to follow scrolling text.  I don't know if that is the screens fault, or the driver, or what, but it is not comfortable to watch at all.  On a desk top you might spin the mouse wheel while you scan the text going by for something specific.  Just not a pleasant experience on this tablet.Also, I have to stay annoyed at the limited memory.  I plan to use this a lot to highlight my trips by showing pictures and movies but I don't always have an available internet connection so streaming is not a good enough alternative.

Reviews.Title: NEED WHITE NEXUS 7
Reviews.Author: Mentallect
Reviews.Content: I bought the 16GB tablet before Christmas after reading all the rave reviews.  I will say that it was a great size, fit in my jacket pocket and the back pocket of my jeans, but I could still read and watch movies on it with ease. I downloaded a lot of movies and books, and pictures, and I had plenty of memory left. My chief complaint is no white Nexus 7 was available.Another issue: When I tried to download some apps from sources other than the Google Play store, I was initially prevented by the 7's settings. The Google store is the default, but this is annoying.  I had to go online to learn how to disable settings to allow me to avoid the Google Play store which I find good, but overrated, and although I have a Google Tablet, I prefer a universe larger than just the Google Play store.Overall, 16GB is plenty of storage for most users.  The imagery is very clear.  The sound is good.  The build quality of the tablet is good.  It feels expensive.  I have owned 4 tablets, and the Nexus 7 is really a lot for the money.  Internet reception was good.  Setting up access for my own wifi was easy.  Its a really nice tablet, and you get a high end product at a middle price point.  Now, they need to make it in white.

Reviews.Title: Very Disappointed!
Reviews.Author: T. M. Gilchrist
Reviews.Content: I did not buy my device from Amazon but from Staples and here it is 6 weeks later and I had to send it back because when I went to turn it on one day, there was no screen! I actually loved the device but when you pay $200 for something you expect it to work for awhile and not have to return it only after using if for a short time! I had read where other people had a similar problem so I am not sure if the problem I had was with a certain batch of the product but I am really disappointed that at this time I am without it! It has been 1 1/2 weeks since I sent it back and I have not heard anything from ASUS regarding it!Terry G

Reviews.Title: Disappointed overall
Reviews.Author: Sasquatch
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this tablet.  But, I can't get past some fatal flaws.  I've been using it for two months now, and here are some observations.  I mostly read, surf the internet and watch videos on my tablets.Pros: The interface (Android 4.2) is great.  Very customizable with many widgets to add to your desktop/home screen.  Love the Google search feature which is available with a simple upward swipe from the bottom of the screen.  Great screen resolution.  Inexpensive and portable.Cons: The sound is anemic at best.  Not much better than the original Kindle Fire.  Audio playback from Netflix skips constantly when paired with my Bluetooth headset (very annoying).  Wireless is noticeably slower then my iPad and wife's Kindle Fire HD 8.9.  Google play videos are slow to load.  Reading books and magazines is a joke.  There is a significant lag for mags and books to load pages.  It's just frustrating.  Battery life isn't that great, and then it takes about 6 hours to charge fully.I hate to say it, but I now know why Apple is killing the tablet market.  Their machine is simply faster with better resolution and apps.  Simply put, if you are going to buy a tablet for videos and books/magazines I would get the Kindle Fire HD (cheaper than an iPad).  Amazon's prices are usually less then the competition.  If apps, videos, web surfing and reading are important, then get an iPad.

Reviews.Title: I want one
Reviews.Author: Marnie
Reviews.Content: Now I want one for myself.  This is awesome  My daughter is a pro.  Very easy to navigate and so easy to travel with.

Reviews.Title: 2nd Best Tablet out there, you know which one is 1st
Reviews.Author: Joan Medrano
Reviews.Content: I wanted a tablet for my wife, so I asked several friends to let me test theirs. Lucky me, I ended up grabbing a Kindle HD, a Mini iPad, a Galaxy Tab 2, a Nexus 7, a Playbook (The worst of them) and an old HP running WebOS (For comparison's purposes only).I tested their performances with multiple apps running, wifi speed and the "fun factor". The iPad won the battle when it came to overall quality but the prize wouldn't justify it's advantages over the Google's contender. The Kindle came real close especially taking into consideration the prize, but the power running under the Nexus' hood would leave the Amazon's best seller biting the dust.I couldn't buy it on the Google Store and I was running out of time, so I decided to go ahead with the prize listed here and until this moment I'm very satisfied with my decision.My wife's daily usage doesn't come close to the tests I performed, so I guess she'll never complain for the system being slow. Apps? Think of anything and there are already at least 7 apps waiting for you at the Google Store. We haven't seen any bug yet, so it's been all fun and no angry faces.The size is also perfect for a woman's hand :)Cons:It doesn't support Ad-Hoc networks which can sometimes be a let down, specially when we're on the road and she wants to connect to my 3G. If you doesn't mind that and you mind the money, then this is the tablet for you. Just choose the GBs you need.

Reviews.Title: wow
Reviews.Author: Andrew Hail
Reviews.Content: this thing rocks. lightning quick, versatile. great buy, shipping was fast. package was still sealed by samsung.i highly recommend. samsung innovates and has proven they will continue to improve, not just mark up prices and rest on their name like other electronic manufacturers---Apple---

Reviews.Title: Nice iPad Mini Alternative
Reviews.Author: Kevster
Reviews.Content: An affordable 7" tablet, with a better screen than the current iPad mini, at a much lower price. Great for browsing, a reader, Netflix viewing, games, etc.  Only complaint is the faux-metal silver paint around the plastic frame, which is chipping/peeling, even with delicate handling.

Reviews.Title: Bad screen
Reviews.Author: Nexus 7 user
Reviews.Content: I revived my first nexus 7 16 gb for Christmas. I noticed it had a circular mark on the screen that wouldn't come off with cleaning. I'd describe it as similar to the mark a GPS suction cup mount leaves on a car windshield. You can feel it with your fingers, it feels rough in that spot. I read there are a considerable amount of others who have had this issue with their brand new Nexus 7 device.So I returned it to where it was bought, but they didn't have anymore in stock, so they ordered me another one. About 1 week later I received the new one, and it had the same issue. I called the store, they dont carry the 16 gb version anymore so all they can do is order me another one or refund my money. I called google, they couldn't help because I didn't buy it from google play store. They referred me to Asus, who offered to repair it if I sent it in. Repair it? It's brand new!At no point could anyone explain why both devices had this annoying mark. My guess: the suction cup mark is from The manufacturing process, maybe it was being held by a machine before the anti scratch coating sufficiently dried. I have to imagine a large batch of these devices with this blemish are getting through QC, probably because you don't notice it until you begin to get some finger prints on the screen (which only happens after some use).I don't want to deal with this anymore, and I especially don't want to wait for another week or more to find out my third device has the same issue. I'd gladly accept another one, if I could check it first before I gave this one back, but nobody will help me with that. I like the device enough (which is why I gave it 2 stars and not 1) but who wants a brand new tablet with a big blemish on the screen?So, I'll probably get a refund and try a different brand. IMO the proper way to handle this would be for someone to offer to personally check that the new device they will send me DOESN'T have the blemish, but I cannot get a hold of anyone (be it ASUS, Google, or the store I bought it from) who will work with me on this. That doesn't make me feel very good about my purchase, especially toward ASUS and Google.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet at a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: L. Fields "SBG"
Reviews.Content: I have had a Nook Color (returned within 14 days) and an LG G-Slate (kept, but didn't love).  For my birthday my husband got me a new Kindle Fire, which I expected to love, since I've loved every Kindle I've had up to that point.  But it really wasn't versatile enough for me, and I sent it back and ordered the Google Nexus 7 instead.As soon as I got it connected, there was a software update.  This is huge for me, because LG never, ever, ever updates.  Literally, I never had a single update on the G-Slate the entire time I had it.  Since October (2 months ago now) Google has sent out 2 system updates.  I'm very happy that they keep things current.  The tablet is very fast, and I haven't had to deal with a lot of crashing or apps that won't work.  The tablet itself feels high quality.  The screen is responsive, and everything works the way it's supposed to.There are only a couple of negatives.  One is that it doesn't have an SD slot, so you can't expand the storage.  I don't expect it to be a huge problem since it has a decent amount of internal memory, but it would be nice to have the option to expand.Another is that you can't do ANYTHING until you connect to the internet.  My home internet was set up so that you had to enter an item's wifi MAC address before it could connect.  But you literally could not do a single thing with the tablet until it connected.  I had to change the settings on my home internet connection to not require the MAC address, so I could connect to it and get in to find the MAC address.  This is a big design flaw in my opinion.  Of all the devices I've ever had (a lot!), I've never had one that would trap you in the set-up until you get it online.Overall, this tablet is a great value.  I expect it to work well for a long time.

Reviews.Title: Beyond My Expectations
Reviews.Author: R. B "raboni"
Reviews.Content: Wow ..... I love this tablet.  It does everything including Kindle books and Amazon movies. It is faster than my wife's new Ipad. I got mine at Staples for 199. Obviously Amazon is protecting its Kindle tablet by not offering the Nexus 7 at a competitive price.

Reviews.Title: great tablet...
Reviews.Author: fdp
Reviews.Content: I bought it because I wanted an Android device and didn't want a large tablet, so this was the perfect combination. I've been using it for over a month and it has replaced all my apps on my iphone (except for a few essential ones). Great screen, perfect for streaming movies and TV shows. I use it for everything from email to news reading to games.

Reviews.Title: Some great features but some flaws.
Reviews.Author: S
Reviews.Content: Overall, the quality of the Nexus 7 is very nice. It looks and feels great, good enough to be the best 7 inch tablet on the market. I believe it is, however some things keep it from being the best tablet, period. The UI can take a little time to get used to - having both widgets and apps on the same screen(s). It is very simple to customize and does give the user plenty of options to tweak. Both Bluetooth and WiFi are available options as far as connectivity and you can upload and stream your songs over WiFi, yet the whole process seems clunky and unnecessary. Putting songs onto the tablet by copying over into the files while connected to the computer with the included USB cable is not only a lot simpler, but it allows for you to play your songs without being connected to WiFi. You can play these songs or watch videos and listen to them through the speaker or try to connect headphones/earbuds to the 3.5mm jack, although doing that doesn't seem to work. I have tried to connect multiple things through the auxiliary port of the Nexus 7, but nothing seems to work unless you get it just right. Even without the ability to get exceptional audio quality with the Nexus 7, the video quality surpasses many tablets of the same size. With an impressive 1280x800 resolution, text, pictures, and videos all look crystal clear. As well, games can look stunning as well.The Google store doesn't boast quite the selection that you can get from the iTunes store but you can still find some great apps and hours of entertainment. Downloading and updating these apps is very simple and the style and UI can make it easy to find what you're looking for, as well as difficult. There aren't too many subcategories to find something sometimes and the search feature is lacking features as you are forced to search the entirety of the store and cannot choose another way.Speed is something that has been advertised with the Nexus 7 and it does have quite a bit. Everything loads and can be accessed quickly without too much hassle, and everything currently in the cache can be seen by simply pressing a button at the bottom of the screen. The experience throughout is something to not be overlooked. Compared to the Nook HD, the Kindle Fire HD, ans the iPad mini, the Nexus 7 is a step ahead. Though some of it's features can see unneeded or frivolous at times, Google and Asus added plenty more good than bad to make the Nexus 7 probably the best 7 inch tablet for a good price. (And from a buyer's standpoint, it's cheaper directly through Google.)

Reviews.Title: Google Nexus 7 Tablet
Reviews.Author: Full circuit construction
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife.  She has an I phone 4s.  I was concerned that the different operating system would challenge her technological ability.  No worries.  She made the change just fine with a little help from the kids and you tube- adding the camera app.  Great resolution, easy to use.  Good size.

Reviews.Title: It's amazing
Reviews.Author: Justin
Reviews.Content: The Google Nexus is a superior product and this came quickly and easily. I would definltely recommend both to anyone looking for an easy to use google product.

Reviews.Title: excelente!
Reviews.Author: Raul J Sanchez C
Reviews.Content: Lo recibi sin problemas, en muy buen estado, y la entrega fue rapida.Los recomiendo ! ! ! ! !

Reviews.Title: Poor Batter Life
Reviews.Author: Catchafire "Bon-fire"
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to support this product but there are two things about this device that upset me: poor battery life and typing.In regards to the battery, after a full charge my battery will deplete extremely quickly which makes the need to be close to a power outlet very important.  This makes the tablet less portable than advertised and more a nuisance than anything.Typing is also a pain.  Making corrections and changes to things typed is very laborious and non intuitive.  Its a bit choppy and doesn't flow as fast as I type.Hopefully future software update to the operating system improves the battery life.

Reviews.Title: ASUS Restores my Faith in Customer Service!
Reviews.Author: Ronald Litland "What Made These Holes?"
Reviews.Content: I bought my Nexus 7 when they first came out. I owned it for about 2 months before it stopped responding to the touch and then I noticed the screen began cracking. After reading all the complaints online about this, I called Google Play. The rep from there seemed like a 17 year old kid who didn't know what he was talking about. He told me that since I didn't buy it from Google, I needed to "Return it to Walmart" I brought my device back to Walmart, but after 7 days they don't take back tablets, go figure. After a bit of arguing, I gave up. Then I figured, it's made by ASUS, so CALL ASUS. The Rep from there wasn't so great either, but he said he'd open a case for me to send it in. I was hesitant to do so, since cracked screens VOID the Warranty. After a week or two I figured I already paid 250 for this thing, I might as well see how much it costs to get fixed. So I packed it in a bubble mailer, and off it went. Not even a week later, I get an e-mail telling me my tablet is on it's way back to me. I figured they were just sending it back since it was a VOIDED Warranty.To my surprise, I just recieved the tablet back today, with a NEW SCREEN and WORKING PERFECTLY. Asus didn't call me to hassle me about replacing the screen, they just did the right thing and fixed it. If I had not gotten a cracked screen in the first place, this would have gotten 5 stars, but heck, if ASUS wants to stand behind their products like this, I'll keep buying them. Like I said, I was surprised, as most companies don't care a bit about customers after they get their money. Maybe they've had so many complaints that they just decided to fix them, who knows. All I know is I trust ASUS now, and I'll be a new customer of theirs from now on. THANKS ASUS!

Reviews.Title: Good Price Good Tablet
Reviews.Author: Francisco Jose Gutierrez Ramirez
Reviews.Content: I think it's an excellent buy, good screen, good processor, nice battery and slim. I don't give it 5 stars, because it lacks a HDMI port and a rear camera. But for the price is reasonable this lack.

Reviews.Title: Five stars but I gave four
Reviews.Author: Pablo Deossa
Reviews.Content: I gave four start because the  flickering screen problem o all the Asus tablets of this series , but its a perfect tablet

Reviews.Title: Does everything an Ipad can do except hurt the wallet.
Reviews.Author: EOD Guy
Reviews.Content: OK, so the ipad can do a few things this can't. But what are you really going to use ANY tablet for: internet, music, movies, email, pictures, apps and little work projects. This does all that with flying colors. Work and acts like any android smart phone, cause its running the same software. Great thing about it is you can have multiple things going and once and keep flipping between them. I take this with me to the gym. I have my heart rate monitor (blue tooth) that connects so I can keep track of my heart rate. At the same time I have my blue tooth headphones in and I'm watching 'The Walking Dead' (I find that to be inspiring show to watch while running). I can keep flipping between the heart rate program and my movie with no problems. The only thing I wish it had was an HDMI out on it. Besides that its perfect for me. I like the size and power behind it along with all the apps. You just can't beat it for the price and for function.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet ever!
Reviews.Author: Lumenarc
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best tablet I owned yet. Way better than a laptop.I take It everywhere because of its size and its abilities are unlimited.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet available
Reviews.Author: Brian Bailey
Reviews.Content: I have owned the 16 gig 7 since the week it came out. I am very impressed and updates have fixed most all issues.

Reviews.Title: What I was looking for in a tablet
Reviews.Author: Louis Naugès
Reviews.Content: Nothing between me and Android; updated immediately when a new version is announced.Light and easy to handle.Very fast and has all the professional applications I need.I had before an iPad and sold it on eBay because I could not find a real value for me.

Reviews.Title: Amazing device
Reviews.Author: desertrider
Reviews.Content: The nexus 7 is a near revolutionary device and portable entertainment center that can fit in your pocket (albeit tightly and in a larger size type pocket). I mainly use it for e-reading and if anyone ever wanted to get into this new way of reading then I highly recommend the nexus. A beautiful display is a pleasure to look at and use, and the storage is ample in the 16GB version. I have been using the nexus for a month or so, putting e-books and some games on it, and I still have half of the storage space left. And one of my games is almost 2GB in size and I hardly ever play it, but if you think you might like some extra storage space then I suggest getting the new 32GB model that was recently released.I have had no problems with any build quality issues, and am constantly using my new "toy" everywhere I go. If you have a mobile internet service in your area then the nexus really comes into its own as a portable internet browsing computer. On the downside, I will say a previous review that talked about the mediocre audio speaker is correct. Even at the max volume it can be hard to hear the sound when watching movies or youtube. However an easy fix is to buy a portable speaker like I recently did (the x-mini II) which should solve that problem. I think everyone who is thinking about getting a tablet should consider getting the Nexus 7!

Reviews.Title: still learning
Reviews.Author: Susan Rose
Reviews.Content: At first I really liked this tablet butmust confess I am not using it as much as I thought I would.When home I have other computerswhen out, I am not always able to connect to wifi.addendum,I am using it even less because it is hard to recharge and turnback on.There is some kind of trick to turn the volume all the way up whenyou push the on button,holding for 30 long seconds.Who wants to have to say a novena just to get it to work?Have been using my samsung note and sorry to say it,just get a bigphoneand skip the tablet thing all together

Reviews.Title: awesome!!
Reviews.Author: Dandelion Wisps
Reviews.Content: This is a great little tablet. I bought it to read books on the plane mostly because I've been traveling a lot lately. Everything has been running perfectly so far.Screen - so clear!Sound - good speakersInternet connection - no lagging so far but I haven't done anything intensiveBattery - on standby for many days, maybe 3-4? if I turn off wifi when I'm not using it, it doesn't seem to use battery at all.Apps - great apps of course!Size - 7 inches is perfect for travel use and as a readerKeyboard - good, but I installed swiftkey which has been working well so farGoogle Now - pretty nifty feature! I haven't tested it to the full extent but it seems fun and functional so far. Decent transcriptionAndroid 4.2.2.2.2.22 or whatever it's on - running smoothlyonly things about it that I'm not totally satisfied with is the camera quality of the front camera is pretty poor and no rear facing camera. But do I really need to be holding up my tablet taking pictures? not really..awesome product!!

Reviews.Title: Sophisticated Power
Reviews.Author: Greg Mudd
Reviews.Content: The Google Nexus pleasantly surprised me with its superior capabilities.  A friend of mine has the latest IPAD.  He was completely surprised when comparing the two products side by side.  The Nexus response time was faster and is capable of executing more Applications ( Aviation Apps, Document editing, Kindle ) concurrently.  When the Apple's memory was exhausted, the whole system crashed. Not so with the NEXUS.  The system slowed, but never crashed.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: DCNY
Reviews.Content: Excellent tablet for the money. Operating system very smooth with nice features (e.g. Google Now & Google Wallet).Display is sharp and size of tablet makes for good reading and game-play.More tablet-specific apps are needed (true for all Android based tablets). Expandable storage & option for 3/4G would also be nice for N7 (although I've read 3/4G as well as a 32G device may be available soon).Overall I'm very satisfied with Nexus 7. I believe it to be well worth the price & would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: There Will Always Be a Next Big Thing
Reviews.Author: D. Dahlbeck "Tappah"
Reviews.Content: I preordered a first generation Kindle Fire. It came, I liked it and I used it for a couple of months, maybe a  year.Then I heard about the Nexus 7, did some research, sold my Fire and upgraded.The Nexus is a far superior product.First, the operating system runs like an Android phone, which made setting up and getting into it a breeze. Unlike the Fire, you can run widgets on the home screen, like calendar and weather, and the Google Now function has some potential.The app store is the other big difference. Amazon is selling Kindle Fires to sell more Amazon content. Plain and simple. It is meant to be used with the Amazon store. The Nexus features a fully functioning Google Play store with access to ALL of the Android apps that you have on your phone.I am not a tech geek, but I can tell you these things: The screen on the Nexus just looks better when playing movies and TV shows, and the Nexus seems faster and more responsive. I have nothing other than feel to back that up.Yeah, I know the newer Nexus 7 is coming and the smaller iPad is out, but if you wait to buy the newest thing in computers, you will always be waiting. Whenever they make something, the newest is right behind it. This is worth the price and is a nice little tablet that I do not regret buying.

Reviews.Title: Awesome but some manufacturing errors.
Reviews.Author: Snowcrash
Reviews.Content: If your looking to get a bigger, more powerful Android experience on a tablet this is it. The 4 core Tegra cpu and 12 core gpu perform amazingly with little chance of slowdown due to custom themes or the most demanding video game. My only complaint is the speaker blew out in less that a day! A little research on Google revealed my speaker was not an isolated issue.

Reviews.Title: The perfect tablet
Reviews.Author: Cranialsurge "Cranialsurge"
Reviews.Content: My biggest problem with the larger tablets is that they are awkward to hold while lounging and especially while trying to lie down and read. Their weight turns me off. This is why I took the plunge and went for the N7 apart from the fact that I'm a geek and an Android fan. The Tegra 3 and the prospect of having a Nexus class device that would be updated promptly was irresistible.So far, the N7 has only dazzled. I take it with me pretty much everywhere I go. It is a great companion device on the bus and while lounging in front of the TV. From Jelly Bean's fluid & intuitive nature, to great hardware, brilliant build quality and a gorgeous screen, the N7 serves me well as a reader as well as a multimedia device.

Reviews.Title: I love his tablet!
Reviews.Author: Sara Pflipsen
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing tablet and i love to use it.. very much! I ordered it directly from google but would recomend it to anyone that i know!

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Jorge L
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about buying this tablet because of all of the terrible comments I have seen. I bought it and I am really pleased with it, it is fast and great for every app. I think 16Gb it's ok for me especially if you have dropbox and google drive. I miss a camera but it's a great product. 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: The best price/value tablet on the market
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This tablet really rocks. I used to have a Kindle Fire and when the Fire HD came out I was planning to upgrade. However, a friend of mine pointed me to the Nexus 7 by Google/Asus and changed my mind. With the Nexus 7 you have access to both the Google and Amazon ecosystems: just install Kindle for Android and the Amazon app store and have the best of both worlds. The only thing you don't have is access to Amazon video but I don't care about it.The Nexus 7 is a lot faster than the original Kindle Fire, has a better web browser and comes with Android 4.1.1 which has been optimized to improve the performance and the user interface.

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Not my first Android tablet, but my favorite. Fast, responsive, crisp screen. No complaints after a couple of weeks of use.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: BillyBonez
Reviews.Content: I bought this as my first tablet, and I gotta say, after getting used to the device, I'm pretty impressed!First let me start off by saying...GET THE 16GB VERSION, if you are person like me and you prefer to have your music, videos, pictures, and documents on the actual device then get the 16gb ver. If you don't mind having your files on a cloud, or your always hooked up to wifi, then I'd suggest getting the 8gb one.  Okay, now onto the review, the Nvidia Tegra 3 processor does a GREAT job running Jelly Bean, I've been able to run high demand games on mine without any frame rate drop that I've noticed at all! The device does a good job running multiple apps at the same time, no issues switching between Sims Free Play, Yahoo mail, and Facebook while all were simultaneously running. I did seem to notice that the device has a little bit of a issue when it comes to it's touchscreen though...if you press too roughly, the device won't register your input, however this issue is resolved simply by using a lighter touch while operating the device. Battery life is pretty good, device ran continuously for 4 hours before needing a charge, (I haven't let mine get below 25% battery life yet, so I don't have a very accurate battery operational time test yet), the device seems to require around a 2 hour charge time to achieve a full charge from 25% battery level.  I'd suggest getting a stylus of some sort, mainly just for the fact that it keeps your screen smudge-free, while also giving you a more accurate touch.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice and Fast Tablet and the size is great
Reviews.Author: Omar
Reviews.Content: At first i thought it was a little small because i have the HP touchpad , but after using it i found the size to be perfect . It's very light and using it is very smooth (Jelly bean and quad core ) , I love it .

Reviews.Title: The best 7 inch tablet by far !
Reviews.Author: tedmingo
Reviews.Content: I've had the Nexus 7 16 GB for about a week now and I can say that it has been a pleasure using this device. The speed and fluidity is awesome, Jelly Bean has really improved the Android OS. The battery life is by far the best I have ever had in a tablet, I do not have to carry a charger with me and if I do have to charge it, I can use any standard USB connection. The IPS panel is unheard of in this price range, crystal clear from any angle.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value and Works Great Overall
Reviews.Author: J. White
Reviews.Content: This tablet is excellent.  Very well designed and great performance.  I have been an iPad user since day one and wanted to try this out and see the best of what Android has to offer.  Android 4.1.1 is very very good and almost as good as IOS 6.  The hardware is excellent also.  Not quite up to the level of iPad but HALF THE PRICE.  Much more value per dollar here.My only complaint is with the lack of real software available for it.  You just cannot buy software as advanced as you can for iPad.  Simple stuff is readily available though.  That is not the fault of this tablet though.

Reviews.Title: Good Tablet
Reviews.Author: CEC
Reviews.Content: I have mine for three weeks or so. I am not a power user of tablets. I browse and watch Netflix. This is a nice tablet. The battery is good and the screen image is even better. I don't see the difference between this and an iPad 2. I compared against the old gen Kindle Fire and the Kindle feels junky. Worth the $199.

Reviews.Title: Real good tablet
Reviews.Author: jhevia
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet, it is not the biggest but it's size let you handle it in a easy way, and still a nice size screen to watch movies or web pages. Also real fast to process video and pages. All this for a reasonable good price!

Reviews.Title: Nexus a great tablet.
Reviews.Author: Francisco Bastos
Reviews.Content: The tablet is very light and easy to use. The android system is fast. A great tablet. The size allows you to carry it anywhere.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet in the market
Reviews.Author: justus
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review view from the tablet and I have to say it is everything I expected and more.The previous tablet I owned was a Kindle Fire and while the fire is indeed a good device it leaves a lot to be desired, such as bluetooth connectivity, access to Google play apps, higher end specs, and the freedom to manage my device how I want to.The main complaint I have with this is software related. This device comes with android 4.1, or Jelly Bean. Jelly Bean does not support flash which makes Web based video nearly to almost entirely impossible.Despite this, the device is incredibly powerful and by far the best tablet on the market. I highly recommend this to anyone and everyone.P. S. The battery life is terrific! Went almost three days on a single charge.

Reviews.Title: Old Technology
Reviews.Author: Joshua Ready
Reviews.Content: This is an outdated model and not worth the money! Buy a 2013 model for just a few more dollars.

Reviews.Title: poor customer service...AVOID!
Reviews.Author: S. Price
Reviews.Content: When this product works it is great, but if you encounter any problems (mine has had charging issues after 6 months of use)then i wish you luck with dealing with Asus. The returns service is a joke, after numerous telephone calls and filling out of forms the device will be picked up and gone for upto 2 weeks. They are meant to email you when they are returning it (they have failed to do this twice now)and have left it on the doorstep for 2 days while we were away on holiday. Device still not charging and they have said that i need to try another charger...are these not under warranty if there is a problem?? Great device which is really let down by poor after care.....the worst customer services i have encountered yet!

Reviews.Title: Don't let the battery die!
Reviews.Author: Rick101
Reviews.Content: If you let your battery completely die it will not recharge, it will not even turn on.  There is a way to restart the normal charging process being promoted by Nexus, but at least in my case it failed and still wouldn't charge.  This was a gift purchased for my parents for Christmas and I am glad I bought the extended warranty.  This sounds like a major issue for Nexus 7's and I will send this in for repair every time it happens until they either fix this so it no longer happens or offer a full refund including the cost of the extended warranty.  Knowing what I know now, I would purchase a Samsung Galaxy.  The Galaxy was out of stock when I went to purchase it, so instead I settled for this, big mistake.

Reviews.Title: Not happy
Reviews.Author: Katalina Golden
Reviews.Content: I spent good money on this product for my daughter for Christmas and she was very disappointed when taking it brand new out the box and it wouldn't charge or hold a charge. I'm sending it back and hope they refund my money so I can choose a different brand tablet.

Reviews.Title: bad customer service and super fragile product
Reviews.Author: D. Campbell "villamom"
Reviews.Content: I started off loving the tablet and I forgave it for crashing a few apps a couple times. dropped it once with a case on and it wouldn't turn on. good luck trying to get a replacement. Asus were totally rude and I was on hold forever. I am now happily typing this from my new kindle fire hd.

Reviews.Title: Almost There
Reviews.Author: Steven Wood
Reviews.Content: GENERAL-The Nexus 7 earns an 8 out of 10. It has fantastic hardware and software, but the build quality is not quite up to par, and it is lacking some almost essential features. Here are the specs:Display Type LED-backlit IPS LCD capacitive touchscreen, 16M colorsSize 800 x 1280 pixels, 7.0 inches (~216 ppi pixel density)Multitouch YesProtection Corning GlassSOUND Alert types N/ALoudspeaker Yes3.5mm jack YesMEMORY Card slot NoInternal 16/32 GB storage, 1GB RAMDATA GPRS NoEDGE NoWLAN Wi-Fi 802.11 b/g/nBluetooth YesNFC YesUSB Yes, microUSB v2.0CAMERA Primary 1.2 MPFeatures Video-callingVideo Yes, 720pSecondary NoOS Android OS, v4.1 (Jelly Bean), v4.2, upgradable to v4.2.1Chipset Nvidia Tegra 3CPU Quad-core 1.2 GHz Cortex-A9GPU ULP GeForceSensors Accelerometer, gyro, proximity, compassMessaging Email, Push Email, IM, RSSBrowser HTMLRadio NoGPS YesJava NoColors BlackBUT WHAT DOES THIS ALL MEAN?The Nexus 7 is the first tablet made by Google. It has stock Jellybean, a plus for all users who hate bloatware. It packs a punch with the Quad-core Tegra 3. You can count on smooth multitasking and great graphics, especially for optimized games. Then there are some mediocre things about the Nexus 7, like the screen. It is fine and does its job, but doesn't make you excited about it.There is a lot of controversy about screenlift, on the outside of the glass. The edge of the glass seems to "Pop out" andit squeaks when you press on it. It can get annoying, but you can send it back to where you got it from.Where it does lack is some key features, a card slot and a back-facing camera. Google did want the costs to be low, so you will not have a microSD card slot. This means you are stuck with the space you get. This is not a dealbreaker, for you can use the cloud for movies, books, etc. The camera would be nice too have, there are times where I wish I had a back-facing camera on my Nexus 7. For me, these two are not dealbreakers. They would be nice to have, but all the other benefits outweigh the negatives.ONE SCENTENCE REVIEWIf you want a 7 inch tablet, get the Nexus 7 because of its super fast hardware and stock android, or the Kindle Fire HD and it's custom Amazon experience.

Reviews.Title: Trend Setter and Game Changer
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I like all those things which has proved the greatest Steve Jobs wrong or even has potential of doing it. Because such things has to be something beyond the greatest. Examples: (i) Software and hardware has to go together: Windows and PC proved it wrong. Then again Android proved it wrong. (ii) Touch devices with stylus dead on arrival: Galaxy Note proved it wrong. (iii) Who reads books? First Kindle proved him wrong. (iv) Tablet of smaller than 10 or 9 inch screens are of no use.AND THEN COMES NEXUS 7 TO PROVE HIM WRONG AGAIN.IN SHORT ITS GAME CHANGER OR TREND SETTER, AFTER THIS DEVICE, SMALLER SIZED TABLETS MIGHT BECOME FASHION AND GO HEAD TO HEAD OR EVEN FAR THAN THEIR BIGGER BROTHERS.MARK MY WORD : YOU WILL USE LESSER BIGGER SIZED TABLETS OR LAPTOP FOR THAT MATTER ONCE YOU HAVE IT.IT'S ALWAYS MORE FUN TO PLAY WITH YOUNGER ONES RATHER.Now please proceed to the detailed review of this great device (this deserve it)1. VERY BEAUTIFUL DEVICE: SIMPLE, SLEEK, SEXY AND LIGHTWEIGHT. ITS LIKE APPLE DEVICE MINUS ALUMINUM IN BACK FOR HALF OF THE MONEY.2. MOST PORTABLE AND CONVENIENT TO USE AND CARRY. BEST FOR CASUAL USAGE: Its just like novel which you can put in pocket and use it any convenient position. Nothing beats it in this regard. People are using it even for serious work.3. VERY POWERFUL.4. VERY SMOOTH AND POLISHED OPERATING SYSTEM equivalent to iOS but more powerful, flexible and customizable. It puts YOU IN COMMAND and don't let you feel helpless or dumb. You can do the things when you have the need for it.5. VERY GOOD SCREEN resolution (216 PPI). Viewable from all angles.6. STOCK ANDROID: BELIEVE ME NOTHING COMPARES TO STOCK ANDROID EXPERIENCE. With other variations you will most likely be outdated for some duration at least and that too with inferior UI.7. COMPARED TO KINDLE DEVICES: ITS BETTER than those as you can have amazon ecosystem on this but not vice-versa. Kindle ecosystem is very limiting.8. PRETTY DECENT SPEAKERS for its size.9. Very well integrated with Google ecosystem.10. GOOGLE ECOSYSTEM IS MORE CONSUMER FRINEDLY IN GENERAL, they have more free, FEATURE RICH applications (almost double). They have recently offered many popular applications free or just for a quarter. I have bought one application @25 cents which otherwise comes for almost 14 dollars. Unlike Apple, Google is not making any money on the hardware as they want to earn on its usage. Remember Apple steals your hard earned money first on hardware then on 'limited' usage too.11. Make no mistake its BEST VALUE FOR THE MONEY: If Apple replaces its plastic back with Aluminum IT WILL BECOME AN APPLE DEVICE and they will charge gold for an aluminum. And mind you plastic here is better here for its does not feel slippery.12. FRONT CAMERA: NO COMPLAINT for what it is made for.It could be better in the following areas:1. Expandable SD (Workaround : by OTG cable in less than dollar and use it with nexus media importer for $2.49 [workks without rooting]) AND PRACTICALLY YOU CAN UNLIMITED STOARGE ON YOUR DISPOSABLE and you can swich/detach/exchange on your will.2. No Flash: This fault is not of Android/Google as Adobe itself is not supporting Flash anymore. (Workaround: Free Puffin web browser [works without rooting])3. No HDMI. I personally don't feel need for it though.4. No Cellular connectivity: Not a big deal as 8 out of 10 tablets sell just with wifi. And you are saving money on hardware and data plan. I tether with my unlocked nexus phone without paying a single penny.5. Speaker sound is little muffled on high volume (use any free EQ application).6. Back Camera: I don't care as I don't want to steer tablet to take photos I want to shoot photos.GOLDEN WORDS IN END: ITS BEST MONEY FOR THE VALUE AND GAME CHANGER DEVICE, GO FOR IT.TIP: BUY IT FROM STAPLES/OFFICE DEPOT/SEARS/WALMART. Seems they have much lesser complaints about quality. We three friends bought this and we are much more than satisfied. Its one of our best purchase so far.

Reviews.Title: THE Google Tablet
Reviews.Author: Sivle M Xinu
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying this is my first tablet, though I am in no way ignorant of Android or Google (being a huge fan of both and having owned two Android phones previously). So, with that said here's a breakdown of this 7" beast.HARDWAREThe Nexus 7 is a collaboration by both Google and Asus (my favorite hardware company).
