Its key features include:+ Corning glass 1280x800 display+ 1.3 GHz quad-core CPU+ Nvidia Tegra 3 GPU+ 1.2 MP front-facing camera+ 1 GB of RAM+ NFC (Android Beam)+ Gyroscope+ Accelerometer+ 8/16 GB of storage (can plug in USB drives if device is rooted)The display is very nice for a 7" tablet. The Transformer Infinity has a 1920x1200 display, but it's also 10.1" meaning it's easier to distinguish. Larger screens make the difference so the resolution for the Nexus 7 is fine and looks sharp. The quad-core CPU is really nice as transitions and page loading very fast (this being helped more by Jelly Bean). This also helps make games run smoother as well as GPU power. The camera is nice as well, though there is no camera app installed at stock (simply download it from the Play Store and it works fine). The only real downside hardware-wise is the little amount of storage space. Being an avid Android enthusiast, I often need space to play around with. However, if you root the Nexus 7, you can plug in flash drives and external hard drives (simply buy an OTG cable and downlad StickMount from the Play Store). The feel of the tablet itself is great. It's very light and the back is rubbery, but comfortable to hold for hours on end.SOFTWAREThe Nexus 7 is a Google tablet, meaning it comes with the latest version of Android 4.1.1 (Jelly Bean) out of the box. This also means that it will have constant support and will always receive updates to the latest Android versions first (and if you're a flasher like me the community for modding it is great). This is my first Nexus device and from what I've seen of the Nexus 7, I intend to have all of my future devices be Nexus as well. Jelly Bean is an extreme improvement over ICS. I won't go into extreme detail as there are reviews on Jelly Bean, but its fast, responsive and smooth (mainly do to Project Butter).OVERALLA definite buy in my opinion. With only a $200 price tag on Google Play ($250 for the 16 GB model), it's a steal and beats out the competition such as the Kindle Fire. True, Apple will most likely unveil the iPad Mini in the coming months, but it's doubtful the price tag will equal this and if it does, its specs will probably be nowhere near as good. Nexus is a constantly evolving brand and this latest installment is a must have for anyone.

Reviews.Title: best android  tab
Reviews.Author: phillipallen
Reviews.Content: I love this tab the display is off the chain .my previous tab were an iPad 1 and a Samsung galaxy 7.this tablet everything loads faster and I don't have it freezing like my galaxy tab did a lot.I bought the 8gb that might not be enough memory for most pppeople but all the books and movies are on the cloud so that's a memory saver .the lack of a rear camera might be a deal breaker for Some people but any picture you take with your phone and if you have a Google plus account will be on there anyway.over all this is my favorite tablet ever until the nexus 10 comes out.

Reviews.Title: Easily the BEST Tablet I have ever owned!
Reviews.Author: Shauna Morgan
Reviews.Content: I've owned many tablets. Acer Iconia a500, a100, Transform Pad 300, HP Touchpad, iPad 2, RIM Playbook (and others).I ordered the Nexus 7, the second they displayed it at Google I/O. Everything during their presentation works well on the Nexus 7. Google Voice Search, Google Now (updates me on traffic to and from work, and gives me the current results of my favorite sports teams and more). Google delivered everything they said the Nexus would do.Expandable storage is not an issue for me. I got the 16GB Nexus, and have yet to fill up the device, even with large games like Nova 3 and Modern Warfare and Shadow Gun. And all these games play great, WITHOUT lag. I even use my PS3 controller (w/OTG cable) to play them. It's nice to have a physical controller instead of screen controls sometimes.The device is really portable, and though it does stick out a little, it fits easily within a jacket pocket or back pocket on my jeans. Yep, I take it nearly everywhere with me. When I need internet, most places I frequent for a sit down, has wifi. And when all else fails, I tether it to my smartphone, for what I need. (For an hour of 4G internet, it uses about 10 - 15% of my phone battery).I can keep going on, but here's the link to my Youtube Review of the Nexus 7. So you can see what I really thought of it:Amazon won't let me post a link, so if you're interested, just search AhmazinSKM on Youtube.

Reviews.Title: For those who mentioned the 8 GB vs. 16 GB storage issue
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey J. Jacobs
Reviews.Content: This might be a solution.Seagate GoFlex Satellite Mobile Wireless Storage 500 GB USB 3.0 External Hard Drive STBF500101 BlackThe Seagate GoFlex Satellite Mobile Wireless Storage 500 GB USB 3.0 External Hard Drive.  From what several have said it should work fairly easily and give you 500 GB of storage, enough to store 300 movies, etc.  It can also be accessed by up to three devices at a time.  For $165, it could work out well choosing the 8 GB and having the saved $50 go toward that bad boy.Just a thought.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet
Reviews.Author: AG "Sooners"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Google Nexus 7 16GB tablet from the local wholesale club and highly recommend it.The hardware build quality is excellent and the texture on the back is indeed like nice gloves providing a nice grip. It has nice light feel. I found the screen to be better than the G-Nexus phone in terms of viewing angle and crispness. The overall feel of tablet seems more solid than the phone. The speaker and camera are pretty good. Battery life is about 7-8 hrs in my experience. It is built by Asus for Google and they have been a pioneer in netbooks.The Jelly Bean operating system is very fluid and compares easily to the iPad, since there are lot of the same major apps and media content in the Play store. The tablet has a navigation app with built in GPS hardware, but requires a data connection to use while on the move, so you will need to tether to a phone. Google has many interesting new features in their system for searches. The search cards are elegant and show a lot of polish. It would be nice for Google to make other basic elements (contacts, calendar, email) of their OS that elegant. Updates come directly from Google also, so there is no third party. You get the latest release as soon as it starts and connects to the wifi.Overall, this is a well made, easy to use tablet that exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: Glitch to be aware of
Reviews.Author: Sarah Jane
Reviews.Content: I bought this tablet 3 months ago. I loved the google nexus tablet until I was travelling with it on a road trip earlier this month and it ran out of battery. When I got to a place where I could charge it up again, it wouldn't take a charge or even turn on.  I have tried to follow directions to fix this problem but so far nothing is working. I am hopeful that I will get this issue resolved but it has been frustrating.  Apparently, it is a bug that happens when the batter drains all the way down.  I didn't learn about this bug util it happened to me, so I am writing about it in this review to make sure prospective buyers of this product are aware.  I really did think it was  great little tablet until this happened.  Now I think I should have saved my money up and just bought a ipad mini.  My husband has an ipad and it has had not issues ever.

Reviews.Title: LOVE/HATE Med School Tablet
Reviews.Author: LongevityNow
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Tab for daily use in Medical School. Love the available apps and portability. With a leather case I can take it anywhere and everywhere. With an external keyboard I type all my notes into it. The Easy Voice Recorder app is perfect for recording lectures and importantly, does not take up massive amounts of storage.My main complaint is not so much a problem with the Tablet but the way I am using it. I have lots of pdfs of medical books. While the 7-inch format is perfect for reading regular books and there are good apps for reading and highlighting text, the problem is that for Medical Books the screen is way to small. There are good readers where you can view a single column but this is very tedious with medical books and, for studying, I like to be able to see the whole page or graphics and text at the same time, this is not good for that.Other issues: My headphone jack only plays one channel and that not even all the time or with every headset. This is a known issue and yes Google is replacing those units but hard for me to send it back as I use it every day. The built in speaker and volume (for speaker or headphones) are terribly weak.

Reviews.Title: A couple of major issues, please read before purchase ~
Reviews.Author: Christopher Barrett "Evil Corgi"
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by both the hardware specs of this tablet and by the ease of connectivity through Google.  I have a Samsung Galaxy S 4G phone so I liked that all of my apps would sync onto both devices, as well as streamlining my e-mail and other settings.  Win Win.  Or so I thought.Here are a couple of the major issues:DOES NOT SUPPORT FLASH-----Update: it does not support Flash, but you can do a couple of go arounds.  They are a bit of a pain.  I installed the Boat browser with an archived flash, and it works well.  But you cannot watch Amazon Prime in landscape view, just in portrait view.  But you can pop out the video so it fits the entire screen left to right, just while the device is in portrait.  I am still looking at various archived Flash versions as well as various other browsers.  Firefox to the rescue please!  (Still having trouble with street view unless you open Google maps in the other browsers).  Google, just give us a Flash app download please that works in your Android 4.1 Chrome browser!------------------So what does this mean?  Well currently I cannot watch my Amazon Prime videos on this tablet.  Instead, Google wants to charge me a monthly fee for Hulu Plus, or Netflix has an app for download.  But the question remains:  why should I pay for these services when Amazon offers a similar service for free?And with the non support of Flash come two very interesting problems: you cannot view the street view mode in Google maps (huh???) and many Youtube videos are not supported.  What gives Google?  Two Google programs that cannot run fully due to lack of supporting Flash?  I for one find this ludicrous.  If Google Maps and Youtube don't run fully without Flash, then why isn't Flash supported on the tablet?Now, for those techies that want to actually play Amazon Videos there is a way, though it doesn't work THAT well.  I actually installed Firefox by going to their website.  From Firefox you can look for an archived version of Flash for Android.  It will be a version compatible with an older Android version, but it WILL work.  Just not very well and not very clearly.  You will have to open Firefox and go directly to the Amazon website then go to Instant Movies and search for your favorite.  I am watching Star Trek TNG and it comes in decently, though some issues with sound and fuzzy appearance at times.  But it's better than nothing until Amazon releases an app (which I hope they will).  I also hope that Google will fix their street view system as well.I will be experimenting with various other archived versions of Flash and Firefox until I find a good match, then I will post in comments.  If you are just playing with Firefox and Flash, then you are not risking anything to your tablet.  Just only use the Flash downloads FROM Adobe's website.But enough of my rant about the lack of Flash support.  Other than that glaring problem there is one more issue, which I am glad to address:  unscrupulous sales of this tablet.  Even Google tried to charge me sales tax (I live in Oregon - no sales tax) and shipping.  Making the total for an 8GB over $250.  So here is the answer:BUY FROM STAPLES.COM :Sorry to recommend someone other than Amazon, but since you can't buy directly from Amazon, you have to pay a larger markup for purchase from a 3rd party seller.  Staples did not charge sales tax, and shipping was free.  It took two days to arrive.  I cannot express how happy I was with that purchase.  They only had the 16GB, but it still cost less in the end than the 8GB directly from Google.  And I still got my $25 Google Play credit.The other factor to point out is Wi-Fi only.  But at $250, I really can't complain.  If you really need a 3G/4G tablet, they do have those and you will spend a pretty penny.Also, no SD slot, but since Google is trying to encourage folks to load content into their 'drive' (their version of a virtual cloud) it seems that 16GB is enough to load many books and apps.  You won't be loading much media onto the device if you're using Hulu Plus, Google Play, or Netflix.  If you have music, I recommend loading it into the Amazon MP3 Cloud, which there is an app for that is compatible with this device.There is a micro USB port, so my Samsung chargers all work with this tablet as well.  You can also connect the tablet to a PC with a micro to standard USB.  I would also suspect that you might be able to use SD memory somehow if you have an SD reader plugged into a USB to micro USB cable.  I am not sure how to make the tablet 'see' the SD card in this instance, but I am sure there would be a software download that would work.  I haven't tried it because I use Amazon Cloud for most of my music.The tablet is actually pretty amazing despite the many flaws listed above.  If you are using it as intended: an E-reader (compatible with Amazon Kindle App), a browser (Chrome really is the best browser for speed/functionality), and a media device (if you are using Netflix, Hulu Plus, Youtube (for most videos), and Google Play).  I have also installed NES and SNES apps and downloaded a few ROMS and play classic games.  There are also many games and various apps for a variety of uses.  You can also load a Google map into the tablet to view offline if need be.  Sadly, I would just use my 4G phone with Google maps in that instance.So why buy this tablet?  Well I would say that perhaps I should have bought an Amazon Kindle Fire.  I miss my Amazon streaming video.  But the ability to sync my phone and use the same apps is a huge plus.  Having Chrome as the default browser is also huge.  Access to the variety of Android ready apps is really one of the best aspects of this tablet.  It does have an HD screen, though slightly less color than the iPad (at $250 less though).  The screen is also half the size of the iPad.  But that's not a bad thing.This is a very portable tablet, unlike the larger, nearly laptop size iPad.  I have a laptop already, so why would I buy a tablet that is less amazing than my laptop when it's about the same size and nearly as weighty?  Granted, if you are going sans laptop, the iPad is a great device.But for a portable (smaller) tablet with lots of bells and whistles, and impressive hardware, you really have the Google Nexus 7, the Samsung Galaxy Tab, and the Kindle Fire.  Each has pros and cons, but for ease of use, hardware, and connectivity I think the Nexus 7 wins.  Though the Nexus has its share of flaws, if I had to go back and buy one again, it would probably be the Nexus.  The Samsung is impressive, and my Galaxy S phone has been perfect; but with the newer version, it also lacks the Flash compatibility, though it has an SD card slot.  The Kindle Fire is an e-reader first and foremost, with decent media use, but not as functional as the Nexus; though it does have Android 4.0.  It really depends on what you are looking for in a tablet.I can say I'm happy with the Nexus 7.  I think there are a few issues Google should address.  Mainly adding Flash would help.  An Amazon Instant Video app would help too (hint hint Amazon).  Amazon just released one for the iPad, so hopefully it's coming.  In my humble opinion, all three mainstream tablets are amazing and competitive devices.+++Pros: Heavy duty screen, great HD display, lightweight, smaller than Kindle HD (less bevel), fast wi-fi, access to thousands of apps via Google Play, access to Amazon MP3 cloud, decent 16GB hard drive, impressive Nvidia graphics, and 10 hour battery.---Cons: Lack of Flash, currently no Amazon Instant Movie app, no 3g/4g model, no SD slot, only front facing camera (no rear).Verdict: you should seriously consider this tablet or the Kindle Fire HD.  Both are the best in the $200-$250 range at this time.  Or wait for the iPad mini.

Reviews.Title: Fast and pretty, but accelerometer doesn't work and unit broke
Reviews.Author: Andrew Beck
Reviews.Content: I'll say this straight off: if the unit didn't cease working after the 4th charge and the accelerometer kept working, this tablet would be one of my favorite gadgets.  But seeing how both of those issues are present here, it gets a 2.First off: the accelerometer doesn't work.  I've seen other threads mentioning this issue as well, so I'm not alone in the experience.  Whenever I use Google Sky Map the screen would shake and stutter.  Calibrating the accelerometer and compass didn't help.  I tried two other Nexus 7's at work and they all had the same thing.  Needless to say all of the 7 owners and I were disappointed with the units.About 4 charges on the battery the unit refused to turn on.  Holding down the button for 1 minute changed nothing, and charging the battery again also yielded no new results.I'm returning it for my money back as I haven't seen any news that the unit is repaired.  Next time I'll wait for the a shiny piece of tech to be out for a while before I buy one and get to test it for Google with my own money.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet, Smooth Operation
Reviews.Author: Luke
Reviews.Content: I have used multiple Apple products in the past and was somewhat unfamiliar with the Android platform.  The transition learning was fairly easy.  The hardware and equipment itself have been GREAT!  This will fill it's purpose perfectly.  I intend to use for the following: e-reader, watch occasional movie with Comcast TV, watch Hulu plus shows, and news and newspaper reading.  The operation is very smooth and fast.  There is no lag in operation.  I really don't have any complaints.  Buy with confidence!

Reviews.Title: Burn your Fire
Reviews.Author: Dr Faustoz D. Iablo
Reviews.Content: Tecnically Superior to Kindle in every sense.  Higher definition, more storage, and quad core processing.  Google have not disrespected overseas users the way Amazon did by making the Fire available only within the US but instead made the Nexus 7 immediately available in Europe and Australia.  I've purchased my last kindle of any description.  Reign on Nexus 7!

Reviews.Title: This is the best tablet at $249, but ...
Reviews.Author: Y. Yamamoto
Reviews.Content: I got the 16GB from Google Play store. It has been a couple of weeks using the device. I like the hardware very much. The tablet is really well made. I feel nexus 7 in my hands much better than my iPad3. However, I keep using my phone, GS3 or iPad3 for web browse, email, skype, facebook, games, Youtube, Netflix, and Splashtop. I do not read magazines or books. I am trying to force myself to use my Nexus 7, but I am not successful changing my habit just yet. Here is why.1. Jelly Bean is nice and smooth, but I experienced some bugs with Apps that were not up to date for OS 4.1. In time, they should be resolved though.2. I like clean OS with less bloatware, but JB needs some basic features like a numerical battery indicator and Landscape mode on the default launcher (because Nexus 7 is a tablet) Sure, I can install Apps to correct all these, but I would like to have them by default.3. No Flash support although it is not the tablet's fault. I can make Flash contents work by side loading the flash player apk, but several browsers often crash watching contents in Flash.4. As we all know, not many Android Apps are optimized for tablets.5. My place is very clouded with 2.4GHz devices, so I have 5GHz Wifi setup. However, Nexus 7 does not support 5GHz. iPad3 and GS3 do support 5GHz.6. The Speaker is weaker than my phone, so no good for Netflix or Skype without a headset.7. Screen is very crisp, but pretty faded due to Nexus 7's aggressive Auto brightness. Sure I can set it to higher value and get nice and bright screen, but I am just too lazy to switch when I change my environment. I would like it to be little brighter from the Auto brightness. It is much darker than other devices set at Auto.8. No Micro SD is OK for me, but I need to store some videos for my daughter. I keep using my GS3 or my old Archos 70 tablet for that.9. HDMI would have been nice. If it had HDMI via MHL, I could have used the tablet as a media player in my bed room mirroring video to a larger screen. I am using GS3 for that now.10. Nexus 7 should have a much better front camera than iPad3, but my Skype recipients told me videos are not good from Nexus 7. It could be the software though since Nexus 7 is not certified by Skype just yet. As a result, I have to use iPad3 or GS3 for Skype.I understand comparing Nexus 7 with iPad and GS3 is like apples and oranges. iPad3 and GS3 should have better hardware from much higher price than Nexus 7, but I still have to somehow find a way to use Nexus 7. The only advantage so far from Nexus 7 is that it is smaller and lighter than iPad and larger screen than my phone. The battery life is not as good as iPad, but it is much better than my GS3. It feels really great in hands. I think Nexus 7's processing speed is on par with iPad3. However, Nexus 7 is slower than my GS3. Maybe that is why I use GS3 more often. If I read magazines or books from tablets, Nexus 7 might become my favorite device. I will keep forcing myself to use it.Conclusion:This is still the best tablet at $200 and $250 as of 8/1/2012, but if you already have other similar devices like myself, you will have hard time finding a reason to use it.

Reviews.Title: Outdated Price as of 10/30/12
Reviews.Author: Sam Bravern
Reviews.Content: This sells for $199 now.  Check Office Depot, etc.  The new 32GB is selling for $249.  Amazing how many uninformed shoppers there are.

Reviews.Title: Big disappointment
Reviews.Author: bchriste
Reviews.Content: Was a big ASUS fan, motherboards, laptops, video cards so was really looking forward to this tablet.  Worked very well for 30 days, then the touch screen started to become unresponsive.  Found that if I turned it off and back on it would work again for a while.  Now it does it constantly making the tablet unusable.  Looked online and discovered this is a common problem with no fix other than RMA.  Contacted ASUS directly for an RMA, been over a week with no response.  I expected much more from ASUS, I will no longer be using ASUS products.

Reviews.Title: AWFUL customer service, Google should be ashamed.
Reviews.Author: electricmayhem29
Reviews.Content: Hi -  PLEASE READ THIS IF YOU ARE CONSIDERING THIS PRODUCT OR NEED A WARRANTY REPLACEMENT!!  A (not so) brief note about my experience with the Google Nexus 7 and my experience with Google Customer Service.  I purchased the Google Nexus 7 in September as a gift and loved it.  Our device began having problems this week, battery not charging fully, and when the charge was low (and device was plugged in) the screen would flicker and could not power off completely and would not retain a charge.  After a full 24 hours of charging the device and leaving it untouched, we were able to get a charge to turn it on.  The speaker appears to be blown as the sound is completely broken coming from the device (grainy and crackling).When I called Google's Customer Service team, the ladies I spoke with were helpful and processed my WARRANTY EXCHANGE promptly and without question.  When I asked the rep if I was getting a new or refurbished device, she advised it would be new, that they do not house or sell refurbished devices.  Happy to hear that!  When I asked specifically if I would be charged for the replacement device, she stated NO, there would not be a charge.  When I received the link to "order" my replacement device, it brought me to the checkout page in Google Play and asked me to supply my credit card to PURCHASE a new device for the full price.  I immediately called Customer Service and was given the standard rep response of "IT IS OUR POLICY" to put a hold on your credit card - in this case, my debit card - to have you PURCHASE a WARRANTY REPLACEMENT.  Um, the last time I checked, I was not aware that companies can bill you in full for a DEFECTIVE PRODUCT. I spoke with several layers of reps that were only able to reiterate their crappy customer service policies and procedures about the fact that the charge for a replacement Google Nexus 7 was required, or I could send my device back and allow their overseas tech team to troubleshoot, fix and send back to me.  I find it hard to believe that there is not a single person working for Google that can remove the charge to replace their defective device.  I am currently waiting for a manager to contact me after Christmas to most likely tell me the same.Hey Google - the reason why Apple is a market leader is because they do not charge you for a defective product replacement within its warranty.  I truly love Google and its services, however, this experience and their rigid customer service policies are completely unacceptable.  I hope someone reads this and can share a similar experience.  I cannot be the only person who is feeling like this is unacceptable out there.  The internet is a powerful tool and I am looking to ban together to get this great company to change the warranty policies of forcing you to put a hold on your hard earner cash to replace their defective devices.Customer Service is trying to tell me that an acceptable work around to my complaints are to contact Asus directly to ship my device to them and allow them to fix and send back to me.  This is utterly unacceptable!Directly from their email: Thank you for contacting Google Play! We will contact shipping escalations to resolve your issue.Google offers advanced replacement warranty service where we place a temporary hold on your credit card.To obtain manufacturer Warranty support without a temporary hold on your credit, I recommend contacting ASUS directly using any of the support options at [...]. ASUS offers a same unit repair service for issues covered under warranty. They also offer repair services for issues not covered by the warranty.

Reviews.Title: Broke after two weeks
Reviews.Author: Kelly J. Gotschalk
Reviews.Content: I liked mine until it stopped turning on and off after two weeks of light use. Now it's just an expensive paperweight.

Reviews.Title: cannot complete setup
Reviews.Author: Spazz "spazz"
Reviews.Content: Horrible. I tired connecting to my company wifi during setup. But due to the type of security we use, I cannot connect. So I am stuck, I cannot bypass this step in the setup and live chat said I was number 83 in the queue and wait time was about 131 minutes. Then it cut off while I was waiting because it was past 6pm PST. Phone support is bad as well, on hold for 30 minutes as I type this out. There needs to be a way to bypass the wifi setup in the startup process.very disappointed in setup and support.

Reviews.Title: Lousy Camera - unable to Skype
Reviews.Author: LLT
Reviews.Content: This device has a 1.2 megapixel camera. I tried to have a video chat via Skype and the quality was beyond BAD. If you are planning to use Nexus 7 to Skype or to take advantage of the camera, AVOID it, it's useless (and shame on Google for fooling people like this).

Reviews.Title: Rushed into production - serious tech issues; little support
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: You may read some of the other reviews to learn how the Google N7 tablet works. Instead I will focus on the hardware by Asus. Many owners and I are having the same critical problem: the Nexus 7 will not charge. I have read online that this is because of a faulty wiring issue so simply repaired that many owners end up doing it themselves. I will not attempt to do this. Luckily I bought my Nexus 7 directly from Google, so they may support their warranty. If you buy yours from anywhere else, good luck. Besides the fact that I can no longer use my tablet because it won't charge, I also find as a 50-something male that the 7" screen is just too small. I am going to probably end up going out and getting an IPad II. What I should've done in the first place!

Reviews.Title: Buggy
Reviews.Author: Nicolás Nieto
Reviews.Content: The tablet was buggy and unstable. I have an android phone that I love but this experience was totally frustrating. I want to clarify that the rating is for the product not the sellers

Reviews.Title: I chose to ignore the buzz about quality issues...
Reviews.Author: njTSX
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I was hit with the inconvenience of one. I just received my Nexus 7 yesterday, and enjoyed it for the hour that it was working. The apps seemed cool, I started loading some ebooks on there, the free Transformers movie looked fantastic even though the movie itself sucks sack. I was happy... until I downloaded Google Sky and started playing. Not sure if it was coincidence, but after that the unit's stopped accepting any of my touches on the screen. It was just done. I tried a soft restart, hard reset, and nothing seemed to fix it even when done multiple times. I couldn't even get past the lock screen, except for 2 random times when I was pawing at the screen like a frustrated 5 yr old. Somehow, my frantic swipes got through the lock screen and I was able to get to settings to do a wipe to factory defaults. Still, the screen was F'd up. So... RMA time for me.I'm not a diehard Apple fan, or Android fan. All I want is something that works well, looks cool, and lets me customize it out the arse. It sucks when you get so excited for something, and it completely disappoints you. I don't want an iPad, I have an iPhone (and honestly it bores the hell out of me). The most customization you can do with iPhone is change your background. iPhones are nice, but designed so simply that it's borderline outdated at this point. They haven't redesigned the iOS look in how long? Or even changed a ringtone in 5 yrs? Oh well... I digress, as my hopes for the Nexus 7 are over for now. It's sad too, because I can tell it's a fantastic device if it actually worked. I've rarely ever, no matter what brand, had a product be this obviously defective. I refuse to even try to exchange for a new Nexus, I am going to wait on the next generation to see if they are manufactured better.If you really want to give it a shot, be aware of the possibility of a dud. If you get a good one, then luck you... from what I have seen in my hour of use, it's a fantastic device.EDIT: I decided to try ordering another from B&H; a week later. Now that I've had a few days, I've raised my rating a little. I do really like the N7, BUT guess what... a few days into using it and I am having a different (also seemingly common) defect. I have screen flicker when reducing the brightness down. It's not terrible, but annoying. If I buy something, it should be perfect out of the box. I also noticed that at the lowest setting, the screen is still pretty bright. To compare, iPhone and iPad backlight goes down super low when wanted, saving lots of battery life and making it easier on the eyes in the dark. I'm not sure why Android refuses to make their backlight control go comparably low (aside from having to get an app to do it). My original Droid phone was the same way with it's overly high lowest brightness setting. Anyway, now I am again stuck in the 'return or exchange' dilemma. I'm not sure I'm willing to take the 'third time's a charm' route.EDIT 12/10/12:I've had my second Nexus 7 (unfortunately bought before Google changed prices/GB versions) and I'm loving it. There are some minor quirks and imperfections (screen flicker, etc as noted earlier) but overall I don't notice it much since I've installed Lux. I use it fairly often, and at this point I'm pretty happy I gave it a second chance. My one new issue is the camera, which is AWFUL quality pics. It's basically unusable except for video chats since it's front facing. I tried it with Instagram out of curiosity, and the picture quality was so bad that I realized it's not even worth messing with it. Slight annoyance, guess I'll stick to my iPhone for that. Other than these things, I now highly recommend the Nexus 7, especially the newer versions where they've probably worked out all the little quirks. Screw the iPad Mini.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I got one of these tablets, the 16gb model for my birthday. What an amazing piece of technology. Don't buy it from Amazon for $300 because Google sells them direct for $199-$249 depending on model. But for the price, this thing BLOWS AWAY the Kindle Fire (Sorry Amazon) and the Nook Tablet and even the Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 7".  The quad core processor in this thing rivals that of my personal computer and I have comfortably overclocked my Nexus 7 to 1.7 ghz. This thing flies! There's no better 7" tablet on the market right now in any price range. Buy one (just not from here!)

Reviews.Title: Great pad, could be a bit better
Reviews.Author: DaveL
Reviews.Content: I just got my Nexus 7 this week and it's really amazing.  Fast, plays all the music, videos and movies I throw at it.  As others have commented, it's a bit short on memory.  So, yeah a micro SD slot would have been nice.  However, there are some great workarounds.  If you have access to wifi while you're using the device, you can take advantage of cloud storage.  The nexus 7 integrates nicely with Google music and Google drive.  Also, if you get yourself a USB on-the-go cable (link: http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B005FUNYSA/ref=oh_details_o02_s00_i00) you can attach a USB thumb drive for extra external storage.  For me, the memory isn't really a problem.

Reviews.Title: Google Play Purchase of Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: LOO
Reviews.Content: This is a short review of the Nexus 7 but more importantly it is feedback on purchasing this from Google Play instead of Amazon.  The Nexus 7 came from Google Play with a cracked screen.  I called Google Play and they gave me a phone number to call ASUS since apparently what Google says about getting a replacement if you call within 15 days from purchase for a defect is not really true unless you go through ASUS and their hoops about whether it is a factory defect or not and then send it to them and they determine whether or not to abide by the warranty.  So, as of now I don't really know if I will get a replacement for my broken on delivery Nexus 7, even though Google says I should.  Having dealt with Amazon before I'm sure Amazon would have replaced my Nexus 7 no questions asked basically.  So, should you buy the Nexus 7 from Google Play - NO!!  Buy the Nexus 7 from Amazon even if it costs a bit more.  Do it for your peace of mind.The short time I had with the Nexus 7 entering apps before I noticed the cracked screen were good.  The screen is bright and very nice.  Touch is nice and just right for sensitivity.  There appear to be many very good apps out there and browsing the internet or checking emails on it seem to be very good.  It pays to read about some of the responses to a google search on what apps you should load on your Nexus.  They were very helpful for me to get the camera working well.  Download the manual as well.  It's a good idea to read it so you don't miss some of the capabilities and work flow.  I purchased this for my wife.  She will be using it to primarily have a place to keep photos and share with friends.  The Nexus 7 is just the right size for her to carry around and show friends and relatives photos of grandchildren, etc.  She will enjoy it, IF I get one that does not have a cracked screen.

Reviews.Title: Excelent tablet.
Reviews.Author: Hernan L.
Reviews.Content: Top noch quality. Very easy to use. Excelent image Quality.The touch screen is almost as good as my ipad II.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet for the Money!
Reviews.Author: natelawrence91
Reviews.Content: I bought the Nexus 7 as a replacement for my Chromebook, as I needed something smaller and more portable. For full disclosure, I have now sold my Nexus 7 because I wasn't using it anymore. Let me break it down for this review.Looks and Aesthetic: 9/10This tablet looks great! Everything is polished and ready to use. It feels a bit heavy in the hand, and is definitely made for use with two hands and not one. At 0.75 pounds, it's a bit heavier than, say, the iPad Mini, but I also think it has more to offer. The screen looks great; graphics are clean and everything is easy to read.Speed and Ease of Usage: 6/10The Nexus 7 is typically very fast. I had a few slowdowns, but I've learned to accept that all technology will have its problems.  The only thing that wasn't good about this, and what brings it down to a 6/10, is the fact that turning it on was a laborious process. I'd sometimes have to hold down the on button for 45 seconds before it would turn on! Sometimes holding the on button wasn't enough and I would have to press and let go. Every time I turned the tablet on was a new adventure. However, once it was on everything flowed mostly smoothly. The one slow thing was when turning the tablet on after a few weeks of being off, all my widgets would take a while to update. So that's just something to keep in mind if you plan to use it infrequently.Apps and Software: 10/10This tablet runs Android Jelly Bean, which is one of the newest operating systems from Android. It comes standard with Google Now, which is an excellent service which puts Siri to shame. I won't try to explain it, but google it to see just how cool it is! The app selection from the Google Play Store is excellent, and there is a wider variety of apps than the Apple Store has. The apps allow you to customize the look and usage of your Nexus 7 to your heart's desire.Internet and Usage: 5/10I found that connecting to the Internet was a little harder than on my laptop, but still relatively easy. The connection didn't pick up quite as well as a full computer, but still worked well. I just want to note that there are almost no free streaming video options on this tablet. You can pay for Netflix and use that app, or pull up Amazon Prime in your Firefox browser (Google Chrome for Android does not support Flash!! Huge mistake in my opinion!) but there are no good options for watching free streaming videos online. Hulu will not work unless you have a Hulu Plus subscription. Also, be prepared for a sore wrist after holding the tablet to watch TV for a while. I thought I'd be using it a lot for downloading and watching TV and movies, but it turns out I hardly used it for that, since it was much harder than I expected.Camera: 3/10The camera is more of an afterthought. I think I used it once to Skype someone. Please remember, tablets are not for photos. If you're filming a concert on a tablet, you're a jerk to anyone who's behind you. Please use your phone, or even better, your camera! The camera on the Nexus 7 is there so the Nexus 7 can have a camera. That's about it.Battery: 7/10The battery lasts quite a while. Depending on how much use the tablet is getting, obviously; I'd say expect 5 hours with heavy usage and maybe 8 hours with light, but continuous usage. Your results may vary.Storage: 9/10You have 16GB of storage. Most of that is available to you. The new trend is to store things in the cloud, so it probably won't be an issue. But if you really think 16GB won't be enough, opt for the 32GB version; it's not that much more expensive!Overall: 4/5Google and Asus have produced a solid tablet with a lot of great features. If you want a tablet, this is definitely the best one to get for this price point. But before you buy a tablet, be sure you want a tablet and not a computer. I made the mistake of assuming the tablet would be good for everything. But anything involving typing is a hassle, even with Google's impressive voice recognition technology!I recommend this tablet, but be sure you know what you want to use it for and see if others have had success with that task. Feel free to ask me questions; hope this helps! :)

Reviews.Title: Almost best
Reviews.Author: Explorerfl "Explorerfl"
Reviews.Content: The tablet performs beautifully. The deficiency? It doesn't have an SD slot so you can add more storage. I have movies on SD cards and don't want to overload the unit by downloading(and paying for) movies. Also, the Amazon price is for the 16 meg unit. You can get the 32 meg unit for the same money.

Reviews.Title: Ooohhh soooo happy...
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Manili
Reviews.Content: Size is perfect.  Was debating this or a larger tab but this is ideal.  Display is super-sharp and easy on the eyes.  Rubber grippy surface on the back is nice.  Micro usb works well with flash drive if you have the right app.  Battery seems to last.  Had about a week, right now we're lovin' it.

Reviews.Title: Just right!
Reviews.Author: shoppingsteph
Reviews.Content: I ordered this with high expectations and they were met! I chose this tablet after using several others including an ipad. The size fits great in my hands and purse. It synced to my google account seemlessly. The shipping was lightening fast too!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Heather Evans
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these for my boys for Christmas.  I love the quality of the images, etc.  Very clear.  The size is perfect for their little hands.  The only problem I have with this is the lack of automatic restriction options.  I got spoiled by the easy, basic restrictions that are offered on the iPod.  I was able to install a password to restrict downloading anything, restrict things like youtube, etc.  And I could turn these things on and off very quickly and easily.  This doesn't have anything like that and I haven't yet found an app that I'm completely happy with.  The constant barrage of messages they get to download new apps and the fact that they can do this at the tap of a button is very annoying.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Tablet at an unbeatable Price
Reviews.Author: john
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I am glad I purchased the Nexus7. It is a solid built piece of hardware that has amazing software. It acts un-android like by never force closing and having zero latency. I have downloaded a few games and they look just purely amazing and play perfectly. I also love the simplicity of the Play Apps and absolutely love the Chrome browser. Never had I thought I could use desktop web pages on a tablet but you sure can with this one. The only con I believe is that you can only use the charger that came in the box to charge this tablet I believe, as I used other ones and while it charges, it does at an extremely low slow rate. Otherwise, amazing tablet, amazing price, and would recommend to anybody wanting to delve into the tablet world, its ultra portable and not too big like the iPad or any 10 inch tablet.

Reviews.Title: amazing!!
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: This product is more than I exspected. My mother has the kimdle fire and this seems like a feather compared in weight. The screen is very vivid and watching Netflix is really great.  I highly recommend. BYE FROM GOOGLE. Its about $30 cheaper and you get $25 free to spend on the play store

Reviews.Title: Fantastic device and best in its catagory
Reviews.Author: Gerry
Reviews.Content: I just got my Nexus 7 last week (from Google store, sadly Amazon is intentionally overpricing this device here or i would have spent my money with Amazon)and after a week here are my thoughts on it and the Fire and Nook.I had been considering an iPad for sometime but just couldnt justify that kind of money for a tablet. A 10 inch tablet is to big in my opinion I wanted something more portable.In my opinion neither the fire or the nook were viable options. I wanted a full fledge tablet not a media consumption device locked into one retailer. (Though I am a loyal amazon user and prime subscriber) I can get both nook and amazon media on this device if I want. All of the features on the nexus mentioned in the other reviews are awesome no need to drone on about those, the GPS was a Deal Maker for me, I wanted maps.The only negatives of the Nexus are lack of memory expansion and rear facing camera. The camera was a non issue for me as I dont see the need to take pictures with a tablet. The memory issue is not insignificant. I got the 16gb version but still I already expect to have issuse downloading several movies for watching on the plane.I got myself comfortable with this issue in the following ways;-Android no longer allows you to save/use apps on external memory, external memory can really only be used for media and even that has some complications for DRM protected media-There area number of external media devices that I think will work for my needs, the wi-drive is one of them, essentially creating cloud storage where ever you are.-For this price it has everything else I wanted and if next year something better comes along I only spent $250 and wont feel terrible having to upgrade.One last note, on the FLASH issue many are raising. It is here to stay, no more FLASH. It isnt a device related issue it is Android and Adobe, both no longer will support it. It works with your Fire today but the OS on that device will likely not receive an OS update. If you want a new device it wont support FLASH.(if the new FIRE supports Flash the OS will be obsolete before it ships) On the nexus there are ways to get it working through other browsers like puffin etc.I am so far very happy with this device and to repeat another review I read, it is the first device I pickup in the morning and the last device I put down at night.

Reviews.Title: Excellent!!!
Reviews.Author: jon-david
Reviews.Content: All I can say is this Tablet has far exceeded my expectations.  The screen is super responsive.  The speed is excellent.  The weight,feel and look is just amazing. I am currently using an LG G2X as my phone, I wanted to upgrade to jelly bean without replacing my phone.  For the price tag you can't find a better tablet. I picked mine up at Walmart for 249.99! Nexus 7 16GB

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: mary jo
Reviews.Content: My granddaughter helped me get this and it was beyond expectations, just like new.  I'm still learning to use it but having fun.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Martin Rodriguez
Reviews.Content: Excellent product, nice! great!The right choiceNice gift to my family. Really great. What I need. Good choice.Thanks

Reviews.Title: My review
Reviews.Author: sista big bone
Reviews.Content: I got this tablet for myself and wind up ordering another on for my daughter. She loves it so much and can't keep her hands off of it!

Reviews.Title: I love my Google Nexus 7 Android Tablet
Reviews.Author: Anita S.
Reviews.Content: I needed a replacement for my Kindle and thought this was a less expensive option that seems to provide everything I need and want.  It's great.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Jose Then
Reviews.Content: This was a "refurbished" unit, basically the box had been opened. The condition was new no scratches or signs of use. Very good price for an older model. Works great!

Reviews.Title: great product!
Reviews.Author: k jay
Reviews.Content: Love it! This is my first tablet, and I travel a lot so this is really fantastic! Will order from again!

Reviews.Title: Good but not a great deal
Reviews.Author: Peter C. Cumminsky
Reviews.Content: The tablet is good, the reason for the 3-Stars is that it was advertised as having 16GB Flash Memory but I received a model with 8GB Flash Memory instead. Not a deal-breaker at the $80 price (used) I paid but a marginal deal not worth the hassle of returning/exchanging. Does what I want a tablet for (Internet/Documents/Media/Games on-the-go) and paired with a clam-shell Keyboard/Case and OTG adapter for flash drives is the perfect portable computer.

Reviews.Title: Excellent purchase
Reviews.Author: J. P. Cleary
Reviews.Content: This was a "refurbished" unit, basically the box had been opened. The condition was new no scratches or signs of use. Very good price for an older model. Works great!

Reviews.Title: Spend the extra
Reviews.Author: Good ole Jim
Reviews.Content: I expected a Nexus 7 that was at least 2012, what I got was a thick as a brick, no camera in the back 2011. What a blind side!  The package said, made in China 03/2013 but after a call to Amazon the rep said this was a 2011. A friend who has a 2013 pointed out the difference between this unit and the 2013 and it's night and day. As the heading stated spend the extra and buy the 2013. By the way on the 2013 the Nexus on the back of the case is parallel with the long side of the case and there is a camera lens facing towards the rear.

Reviews.Title: Beware Asus Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Norman Spinrad
Reviews.Content: I bought a Nexus 7 in Sept. 2013.  Died on me a few months later.  Sent it back for repair.  Got it back. It worked, then died. Called Customer Service, was given instructions for a hard boot--plug it in hold both buttons down until a preliminary screen comes on, follow the instructions.  It worked.  But I had to do it repeatedly.  Then it died completely, nothing worked.  Sent it back again, was told it might have to be stripped of all the apps, files, so forth.  No choice, I had to agree.  But the deal was that if they had to do that, they'd send me a new tablet.  After weeks of agonizing online communication, it, or at arate, a Nexus 7 finally arrived.  But without any charger, either a new one or the one they had told me to send back with my tablet.  Took a week or so to get them to send me an Asus charger.  In the meantime I bought a third party charger on Amazon because I needed the device.  The Nexus 7 charged fine with that, and I had to reinstal everything at my own expense.  The charger from Asus finally arrived. I used it, and it drained the battery dry instead of charging it.  Tried the hard boot procedure with the Asus charger.  Didn't work.  In desperation, tried it with the third party charger, worked fine.  So I complained about this whole thing to Customer Service, and today they finally called me and told me not to use the third party charger, just the Asus charger which had killed the battery charge or worse. In place of the recompense I was promised--at the very least a new updated Nexus 7, I seemed to have gotten the old defective one stripped and maybe fixed and a defective charger.  I was told that my only alternative was to ship everything back A THIRD TIME.  To what?  To "verify the situation."  And then what?  Stone walled.  So now I have a Nexus 7 that works for the moment but can't be trusted and Asus telling me to use the Asus charger that trashed the Nexus 7 and not the one that made it work!  What am I supposed to do?  How can I trust this Nexus 7?  How am I supposed to trust the Asus charger?  One thing is certain, Asus, the company and its horrendous so-called "Customer Service" is not to be trusted.  Not by me, not by anyone, not by Amazon.  Be warned!  It's not a bad tablet when it works.  But when it doesn't, you are very likely to be screwed!

Reviews.Title: Exactly as posted
Reviews.Author: CConti
Reviews.Content: Great value for the most current generation Nexus. Great condition. Really bright display. Suggest getting an anti glare shield if you will read on it out side.

Reviews.Title: buy it period!
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: King of the android tablets for a fantastic price. Either version is excellent. I have replaced my computer with these tablets and I am very happy! ASUS kicked ass.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: LibLadyB "squidbee"
Reviews.Content: My son rec'd this one to me, it does everything I need to do! (I bought a  cheap case at 5 Below...)

Reviews.Title: Great Device
Reviews.Author: Joe G
Reviews.Content: This is a great device and does everything I need it to do, I love the battery life and the screen is bright and clear.My only complaint is I had to modify some of the settings on my router so this would have better than a 1.3 MB connection.

Reviews.Title: Generation I
Reviews.Author: Mr. Scott
Reviews.Content: I hadn't realized there were different generations of the Nexus 7 until after I received it.  I purchased this as a gift for my son and picked one up elsewhere for myself.  It was hard to get accessories for this one but if you search a lot you can find them.The device is outstanding.  It is fast, the screen is clear and there are SO many apps (tons of free ones) that you will definitely want to get one with plenty of storage space.  I keep a couple of movies and several songs on mine for plane trips and a few games for when I am having ADD moments and can't surf.Overall it's a great device.  I would consider getting one for any member of the household.  Great price and the perfect size.  You don't need to be part of the Apple crowd, here.  They cost too much and don't have nearly the quality of the Nexus, Galaxy or Kindle line.

Reviews.Title: Love It
Reviews.Author: jcurry65
Reviews.Content: We purchased a used Nexus and you cannot even tell.  It works beautifully.  Thank you.  If I can get another for my kids, I will definitely choose this seller.

Reviews.Title: Best 7" Android
Reviews.Author: Christopher Stapleton
Reviews.Content: The Nexus is hands down, the best 7" Android tablet you can buy.  I have 2 and both have exceeded expectations.  Could not imagine paying $100 or more extra for an Apple.  The Nexus is only $20 or so more than other high-quality Android tablets, and it is worth it!

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: Dee A Chapman
Reviews.Content: This tablet arrived in beautiful shape, and it appears brand new.  Not a dent or scratch to be found, and in pristine shape.  Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: Leona Thompson
Reviews.Content: I love my Nexus 7! I would recommend buying it! I have had no troubles with it! I have had to return 2 other tablets because of trouble!

Reviews.Title: Powerful processing in a small package
Reviews.Author: Mallory E Woodard
Reviews.Content: A versitile operating system on a small, hand held tablet makes internet browsing, gaming, and word processing a breeze. Would suggest to others!

Reviews.Title: Both tablet and service were great!
Reviews.Author: Aswan Benjamin
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Nexus 7 from seller pspcorman. Amazon's tracking service said it would get to my house by April 8. It got here on the 21st of March! It arrived in very good condition with only a few light scratches on the screen. My only gripe with it would be that he seller, pspcorman, did not wipe/reset the device to factory settings before shipping it. When I got it, I was signed in to his email, facebook, google play account, etc... Other than that, I have no complaints. Thanks for a great product and great service!

Reviews.Title: Fine when it Works
Reviews.Author: Hockey Mom
Reviews.Content: Doesn't have a rear facing camera. Very hard to take pictures of things on the screen. Pictures usually end up having the volume picture in it. This tablet is very hard to charge and it doesn't work when plugged into the wall. If the tablet goes dead, good luck trying to recharge it as it won't turn on. Save your money and buy something else.

Reviews.Title: happy wife happy life
Reviews.Author: DeShawn Price
Reviews.Content: my wife loves it..she takes it everywhere. I got it for her as a birthday gift and she enjoys it.

Reviews.Title: okay for my two year olds cognitive development
Reviews.Author: alice tawney
Reviews.Content: If you like to play or surf for hours buy a lap top.  If you only need a hand held this battery lasts 5 or 6 hours.  I got it for little ones cognitive development games.

Reviews.Title: The battery lasts just 2 months!
Reviews.Author: Leonardo Angulo
Reviews.Content: Hi,The product was just what i needed but unfortunately after 2 months of light use is did not switch on anymore.I reached the official service of Asus in Uruguay and they intended to sell a new battery for almost USD 100.

Reviews.Title: Best tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: Joshua Kolacsky
Reviews.Content: I have had this tablet for a while and love it, recommended to friend and family and not 1 complaint. Very fast and responsive and would not pick any other. Battery life is great and not a single issue thus far and I own both generations 1 3g and the other wifi.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: M. Gaines
Reviews.Content: Purchased as a gift for son this is a great gift. She has loved this from day one. . .

Reviews.Title: be prepared to replace in 1 year
Reviews.Author: bookworm
Reviews.Content: I really liked this while it worked, but I had a problem with the screen which I had to pay to have replaced, and now a week after the warranty ended the usb connection is loose and I can't get it to charge reliably.  Next purchase will be something other than ASUS as their customer service is ridiculously bad,

Reviews.Title: great but resets too often
Reviews.Author: Nav8s
Reviews.Content: I have owned mine for nearly 1 year.  Pros:  perfect size, great visual detail on the screen, Play Store purchases are easy and numerous, easy navigation and use.  Con's:  unit resets for no reason, screen gets sketchy and insensitive to touch about once/day and needs to be rebooted,needs imbedded USB reader. I am mixed about recommending someone buy it because the reboots are a pain in the butt.  I have an iPad as well (original version) and do not experience these issues.  My next purchase will not be another Nexus since there are many choices.

Reviews.Title: The best 7" tablet in the market
Reviews.Author: Alexv77084
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth one that i bought, they are the best in the market. Never a problem with hardware/software

Reviews.Title: Better than expected.
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: It runs faster than expected and is just all around better than I hoped for. I love my new nexus.

Reviews.Title: Don't know what I do without - Great for my studies.
Reviews.Author: Brian Kocjan
Reviews.Content: Great for college students. Useful for downloading books. Use everyday. Don't know what I would do without. Many uses for me.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet
Reviews.Author: aquaman
Reviews.Content: I  bought this tablet as a gift for my grandson. He seems to like it. The price was right and shipping was fast.

Reviews.Title: the backplate is sumptous
Reviews.Author: valence electron
Reviews.Content: first android tablet, definitely a big fan. battery takes forever to charge, but lasts a week +wish it had a better rocker for volume and a clicky power button, but still those are more a sidepart of usage so still fivestars

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have purchased a cheap tablet, an Amazon Kindle fire, this Nexus one, and have used the Apple Ipad.....by FAR this Google Nexus tablet is the BEST!!!!!  It's lightweight, has plenty of computing muscle, and has fantastic pixel power (watching Netflix, I can see facial & skin blemishes)...and my favorite feature is the placement of the on/off switch and the manual volume buttons....they are on the side but moved more under the side so you do not accidentally turn it off and/or mess with the volume...ALSO, it rotates to ANY position you are in (which the Kindle Fire does not)...and if you have a cell phone plan that isn't too costly to add extra devices, i would recommend upgrading to the Nexus 10 which has 4G capability in addition to the normal WiFi connectivity.

Reviews.Title: Loved it when I got it, but battery now will not work
Reviews.Author: justin block
Reviews.Content: Liked it when I got it, but the battery failed after a few months and the thing refused to charge. Spend a little more money and get an ipad. My girlfriend has an ipad and she never experienced half the problems I had with the nexus

Reviews.Title: Item seems to have been damaged and repaired
Reviews.Author: Ricknel Marshall
Reviews.Content: Item freezes and restarts on its own. I am all the way in Jamaica so its hard to return the item before someone travels back to the states to make a return... That might take months...Sigh... I am so dissapointed

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: elvy "elvy"
Reviews.Content: I purchased 3 for Christmas. One I kept for me and gave as gifts the other 2. Couldn't say enough about this android tablet, we all love it ( included my 5 and 3 year old daughters)

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: J. Garcia "webby"
Reviews.Content: This is such a horribly built product. The OS may be sound but anything ASUS makes is made on the cheap and dirty and boy do I mean dirty. When I had problems with mine just 2 months out of warranty, without a bump or ding on it and a known issue (the touchscreen) I did all the troubleshooting through Google support then sent it in to ASUS. They never said what was wrong and to repair it $180 (nearly the price I paid for it and more than these are). I contacted Google support again whose Supervisor Rob ultimately made me feel like I would be taken care of but it was a stall tactic only to be told there was nothing they could do.It is a piece of junk. Plastic junk. Really your money is much better spent saving for an iPad or Samsung device. Please save yourself from being out money and buy anything but ASUS.

Reviews.Title: Totally Ignorant Newb
Reviews.Author: Cape Coddess
Reviews.Content: I'm a complete newbie, totally ignorant, not even a cell phone. I have come to love my new Nexus 7, even though I couldn't get it out of the box without tearing it.  In the first hour I was ready to send it back do to it shutting down every couple of minutes.  Then I found the sleep function and turned it off.  Afterward I had to learn about Chrome, Android, apps, Jelly beans, Kit Kat, widgets, long hold, how to slide things around and read symbols without words, among the myriad of other things. This took about 2 hours. After downloading a camera app I can use it to take pictures and videos of my cat who has become camera shy due to the flash on my digital. This is a great discovery! Now I'm dictating this review on a notepad app I just downloaded , then I'll figure out how to copy and paste it to Amazon.  I still haven't found the apostrophe on the keypad but maybe one day...--Sent from Fast notepad

Reviews.Title: AWESUM BUY AN U WILL LOVE IT !!!
Reviews.Author: April Miller
Reviews.Content: WOW THIS TABLET DOES EVERYTHIN AN THEN SOME !!!  If u are looking for a tablet just to do all the bare nacessities, then this is the one to purchase. JUST WONDERFUL AN NOT HARD TO OPERATE.....:-)

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: kerb
Reviews.Content: My wife loves her new tablet, I just wish that i would have seen the warranty while i was buying this tablet. But its awesome and my wife highly recommends it, Plus the price was a Great price!!! Amazon is Awesome!!!

Reviews.Title: Great for the price! Solid tablet.
Reviews.Author: Jason Carter
Reviews.Content: I wish the screen was bigger but it's not that big of a deal. Arrived in a timely manor, and does everything I need it to do!

Reviews.Title: great Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: Bruno
Reviews.Content: again great product I love my Nexus 7  absolutely the best I recommend it to anybody who wants a small portable device

Reviews.Title: Google just makes things simple
Reviews.Author: Luke Burgess
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this product to anyone who needs a tablet and loves the camera they currently use. This has no back facing camera, but the front facing camera works well. Just don't buy this thinking you can take pictures of the stuff in front of you.Google Docs/Drive works great on this thing and I love it. Google also lets me control the device from my Google account, this just makes things so smooth. It's like a portable Google account access to me.Terminal is also operable on this Android, so I can SSH into anything.The hardware is great, other than installing new apps(I can do this remotely from my Google account anyways), this tablet goes fast.It may be big in my pocket, but if I need to use my hands for some thing else I can fit it in my pocket.

Reviews.Title: To quality and beyond!!!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love my nexus 7. I've used other tablets and this one fits me the best. You won't be disappointed! ...... Unless you are, then to bad for you. ���:-\

Reviews.Title: Easy to use.
Reviews.Author: Mr. John J. Bonner
Reviews.Content: This tablet provides all the necessary features for a great product.Very easy to learn and use. Prefer it to my ipad.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Norm
Reviews.Content: Wow, am I glad I got this one. This tablet exceeds all my expectations of what a tablet should do. Got it for the wife for Xmas. I don't think she's put it down yet. Great for the gamers with "older" eyeballs. Does everything a smartphone does except make calls, with a much larger display. Quality product.

Reviews.Title: Nice toy to play with
Reviews.Author: Yasuaki Matsumoto
Reviews.Content: I mainly use this to read ebooks. Sometimes to watch video. This tablet has more than enough capacity for ebook reading. The display is great to see photos and videos. Battery life is satisfactory.

Reviews.Title: Excelent Tablet
Reviews.Author: Ramsés Del Rosario
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a gift for my girlfriend, because she just moved to Android and she loves it, it has a long battery duration, the processor is great for her games and all that stuff. I will like it to have more compatibility with some apps, like "Angry Birds Go" it says that it can't be runned on this device despite that it has the power to run that game.

Reviews.Title: Love my tablet
Reviews.Author: willy
Reviews.Content: I had no idea how much I would use this tablet. It's very user friendly, nice size and perfect even for us older 65+  folks who aren't as computer smart as some are. It use it for  so many things. Now, I would hate to be without it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome !!
Reviews.Author: Melissa
Reviews.Content: All I can say is AWESOME......I love it, I take it when I have a doctors appointment. 'you know it gets boring just sittin there'. Battery life is great. And it really replaced my laptop.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Rocio Hernandez
Reviews.Content: My niece loves her tablet, she can watch her favorite shows now :)  I used this model before and I must say it's great. It's fast, light weight and the display is amazing.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet
Reviews.Author: Dan Bohn
Reviews.Content: Was a little confused by the shipping, and I received the 16 gb not the 32gb. Otherwise it's a great tablet.

Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet
Reviews.Author: Carlos Pomales
Reviews.Content: This was a gift for my sister. From what she tells me, it's a nice tablet. She's always on it so it must be. However I did not realize that this was the first generation until after I received and it seemed a little overpriced considering the galaxy 2 was less money with more features such as a back facing camera. Also the front camera, although I realize they tend to be less quality overall, should have been a bit better since it is the only camera. Then again, I'm not a technological expert, so maybe I'm asking for too much. Of course, my sister has no complaints because "I have a tablet!!!"

Reviews.Title: This is the best Android tablet yet.
Reviews.Author: Magnus
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet, and am having a lot of fun with it. Clear, bright screen with great resolution; dual processors; convenient size. I have an iPad, and the Nexus 7 and the iPad are almost neck-and-neck, with Apple having the edge in number of apps and seamless integration of media into its devices.Hope to see Google catch up and improve their own on-line ordering and download experience. It's a great platform.

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: tatiana
Reviews.Content: it is great , small and fast, very easy to manage, love it!!! and also affortable, it was used but in a great shape

Reviews.Title: Excellent tablet!
Reviews.Author: rdkeith
Reviews.Content: Excellent tablet and great price for this quality. I've been using this tablet (pre-2013 model) every single day for a couple months now and love it. Battery life is great, even with Wi-Fi on, screen is very sharp and clear, plenty fast. I have read some negative reviews but I have dropped this several times (I have it in a cover) onto hard floors but it's never given a bit of trouble. There is a new model out (2013 model) with faster processor, lighter weight, etc, but I would highly recommend either model. Just be careful when ordering if you want the new model, make sure it says 2013 model and get a cover that fits the 2013 model (they are different size than earlier model).

Reviews.Title: Great tablet choice for my 12 year old
Reviews.Author: Bill Selander
Reviews.Content: Great tablet for my 12 year old. Has WiFi and since he only uses it at home, great. One down side is that it doesn't have a camera on both sides, so he can't take good pictures for Instagram easily.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!!
Reviews.Author: Trisha Jorgensen
Reviews.Content: My son was devastated when he broke his first nexus. I ordered this one for him and it was brand new still in the package. It met every expectation we had! Shipping was very fast too. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: Best all purpose tablet you can own.
Reviews.Author: Andre Tannus
Reviews.Content: Amazing tablet, awesome screen, light, perfect for every day use.Every on in my family has this Tablet, and they all love it.

Reviews.Title: Google taking over every industry one market at a time.
Reviews.Author: David Nason
Reviews.Content: A solid tablet from Google at a beyond affordable price in the market. Look no further if quality is what you want, can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: Excellent entertainment tablet!!!
Reviews.Author: Brandon Hayes
Reviews.Content: This tablet exceeded my expectations in quality, appearance, and ease of use. As a long time iPhone user I was skeptical of the Android Operating System and any manufacturers ability to create a tablet that I would be happy with when compared to an iPad. The Google Nexus 7 was perfect for me and I'm extremely pleased with it. It's different from the iPad / iPhone in a GOOD and refreshing way, and it has a beautiful display screen. I bought a low profile case for it and it still fits comfortably in my back pocket; which is 1 of my favorite features, aside from the fact that it was $200+ cheaper than an iPad mini. Good battery life, excellent display quality, and it just feels good in your hands. I've used Google for years for business, so the fact that the Nexus 7 is fully Integrated with Googles ecosystem is perfect for me in so many ways. This is basically an entertainment device for me, I do not use this for work at all; so for what I use it for it is the Perfect MINI Tablet. I'm sure it would work fine for light business related use, but I wouldn't choose a Nexus 7 over an iPad for everyday business use; the Nexus doesn't have the horsepower that the iPad has to do multiple projects at 1 time, but it does 1 thing at a time VERY WELL. Thats my opinion. Google Nexus 7 16G tablet gets 5 STARS in my book.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Nicholas Kia Alimohammadi
Reviews.Content: It's great! I love that is has such good video, and I can write Google Drive documents! It's also very small compared to many tablets, so it doesn't take much space, but does what I want it to.

Reviews.Title: Good tablet for the price
Reviews.Author: M. Montour "mmmcboop"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this particular tablet for use in a school program.  I have not begun to use all it's features but it is a good price for a sound item.

Reviews.Title: good but needs some work
Reviews.Author: Dustin Leichsenring
Reviews.Content: The nexus 7 on the whole has been very good. I purchased it initially for taking notes and plugging in my schedule while working. As time has progressed I've personalized it somewhat but findthe lack of.flash support annoying. The way the touch screen interacts with web pages could be a little better as well. There's no way to indicate you're hovering over something like you can do on the galaxy phones.

Reviews.Title: nexus
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am actually using it to rate it right now, I really love this thing, it is fantastic! My only issue is that it doesn't support flash, but that's it.

Reviews.Title: Amazing!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I feel so lucky, I got a wonderful tablet at a great price!  The tablet is perfect, came fully charged with cover and cords, I'm loving it!

Reviews.Title: This is the "Best"!
Reviews.Author: Mary P.
Reviews.Content: I'm very please how well it performs.The only problem...is the difficulty in "PRINTING".I have installed several "printing apps" and the only item I am able to print is gmail. Still researching!

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: VIV "Pretty Lady"
Reviews.Content: came in a timely fashion, tablet was in great condition as described as well as had everything in the box!!! my husband loves it

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7 Experience having owned an Asus TF101 and an iPad prior
Reviews.Author: Charlitos
Reviews.Content: Things that make this product great?  The size is perfect, I absolutely love how I can hold this item with one hand comfortably (I can't palm a basketball).  It's quick and the screen is bright and clear.  The only thing I have to say is that the colors seem a little bit washed out when compared with my Galaxy Nexus and my Asus TF101.  The price is great, reading on this thing is also excellent!  Typing in landscape and portrait are also a breeze.  I find that the buttons are the perfect size for me in portrait mode, in landscape mode they work great as well with out having to over extend my thumbs; if you have ever owned a large tablet, you'll know exactly why this size is great for typing in both orientations, it is cumbersome to type in landscape on larger tablets.  Another great feature, as this is a Google product, you're going to get Android updates faster than other tablets along with less bloatware (yes, you can root, but I personally have no reason to yet).  It also fits in my jean pockets if I want to carry it around.So why did I take away a star?For starters, the battery life is just okay.  It works, but if you're using NetFlix on battery, it will only last about 5 hours until you have to charge again.  I got about 10 hours on my Asus TF101, obviously, this is due to the dimension limitations and battery size.  However, I also noticed that even with light use, I still have to charge my Nexus 7 every 2-3 days.  My Asus TF101 and iPad 4 lasted a week with light use before needing a charge.  I'm not sure if this is just the Nexus line or what, but my Galaxy Nexus also has a similarly short life span.The charger that came with it, boy, I was really spoiled by the Asus TF101 with their fold up prongs on the charger.  I wish that this one had fold up prongs as well, but the charger is slim.  My other gripe - this cord is short, it seems to be a common thing with tablets and phones these days, really short cables.  Be sure to have at least a 6ft USB 3.0 extension cord handy to take advantage of standard charging speeds, otherwise, on a USB 2.0 cable, it will flip to a slow charge state.While I've had it, the only times it ever shut off on me was when I was trying to download too many e-magazines simultaneously.  It would shut off during the process, but it was an easy thing to just queue up less files at a single time.  Another problem I seem to have with mine is when I near 100% battery while charging or am at 100% charging, having my earphones plugged in and listening to anything causes static to come through.  I'm not sure if this is only on my Nexus 7 or if this is just how Nexus 7's are.  I haven't tried to call their support line yet.Things I wish this had?  Rear camera, rear LED, and dual side speakers for landscape mode.  It's not a big complaint, but it would just be nice features to have.Why did I opt for this instead of the new FHD?  The price mostly, and the newest FHD doesn't have a rear LED yet.  I suspect they'll throw one in on the third generation device.Would I buy another Nexus 7?  Definitely.  It is almost the perfect device.

Reviews.Title: great value for the $, even taking into acct that most of us upgrade every few yrs!
Reviews.Author: feedthecat
Reviews.Content: As there are many excellent reviews here that hilight the pros and cons of this tablet in detail, I need not go into its technical merits or lack thereof.Just wanted to say before this tablet becomes "old news" that I've never had any problems with it and that I've been very satisfied with the Asus Google Nexus 7, 'tho I ought to mention that I am not very tech savvy and I only use tablets to email and websurf.  Still, it's been fun.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Tablet
Reviews.Author: wade lihl
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet, fast shipping! I would recommend this seller. Google nexus is the best! Excellent battery life. Downfall is no place to put a memory card.

Reviews.Title: so awesome!
Reviews.Author: hmmm
Reviews.Content: I'm in love with my Nexus. It's fast, super easy to use and very light. It's a great work tool and a great entertainment center.

Reviews.Title: great little device
Reviews.Author: Eric Hess
Reviews.Content: I wanted a tablet solely for travel but I have yet to take a trip. Since receiving this tablet my laptop has been sitting on the side lines.

Reviews.Title: Awesome tablet, Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: Roel Isip
Reviews.Content: Fast, screen resolution is great and battery life is okay for as long you follow the tips on how to save battery life on android tablets. You cannot compare the battery stamina with the ipad though. Everything is awesome! I like it a lot! I am using it more than my ipad. Easy to carry around, lightweight.

Reviews.Title: im so happy
Reviews.Author: angelina morales
Reviews.Content: I love my tablet. Its easy to use  and its fast. It was worth 200 dollars. I would suggest anyone get one. its even good for teenagers.

Reviews.Title: Great when it worked...
Reviews.Author: Paul W
Reviews.Content: Had the Nexus 7 for nearly a year. It's a fast tablet and the OS is excellent, many people will have already commented about the lack of microSD slot and rear-facing camera, but for me whilst the tablet was working weren't a big deal. However, 11 months and 2 days after purchase it no longer works and I'm left with a brick. For a few weeks before the terminal fault the tablet had charging issues (this seems common fault from the Nexus help page) and had to try Google's suggested workarounds, now nothing... bought a Galaxy Tab 3 to replace, can only suggest the product was rushed out last year and not tested properly. Very disappointed

Reviews.Title: Quite affordable, but battery is poor...
Reviews.Author: Thomas Andrikus
