Reviews.Content: Pro: The price is only around $200, which is one of the cheapest tablets that provide more than just e-reader functionality. It is also lightweight.Con: The battery life is very short. If used for regular browsing, it would last around 4-5 hrs before it drops from 100% to 15%. But when we use it for watching videos such as Netflix, it lasts around 1 to 1.5 hrs before the battery percentage drops from 100% to 15%.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7 tablet
Reviews.Author: JW Long
Reviews.Content: Very good size and function for checking email and reading news feeds as well as electronic books. Also the Android OS is almost identical to my Samsung smart phone.

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: Smile
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet. It is very user-friendly especially for those who are less tech savvy. The apps are easy to work with and overall the quality is very nice.

Reviews.Title: Rocket Service
Reviews.Author: John Milne
Reviews.Content: This really worth of time and spending, this product was received as described with in great condition. for that it will rate as an A+++it nice doing business with you

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7 - a great return for what I paid.
Reviews.Author: db "Doron Blazer"
Reviews.Content: I bought it as a gift for my son.He is the perfect usage validation "engineer" :-)He is treating it roughly, physically and "mentally" (loading lots of stuff all the time).For months, the device is going some rough times, and so far so good!!!Also we are getting android updates on time.You can say I am very pleased with this buy.

Reviews.Title: It's amazing
Reviews.Author: tonz42
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet it came in the condition the description said it was in and i just can't stop using it. It was delivered when they said it would be here and it just an amazing tablet that i bought.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7 user-friendly and well-designed tablet
Reviews.Author: LindyLou
Reviews.Content: I debated about whether to buy a Nexus 7 or iPad Mini and researched both in depth. However, in the end because my smartphone is Android I went Nexus 7. After using the tablet now for more than a month, I'm very happy with my decision. Because I'm already on Android and Google platforms, every one of my previously purchased Android apps automatically downloaded to the tablet when I set it up. I can read all my Kindle titles using the Kindle app, view Netflix videos on the tablet, etc. The sole missing item I wish the tablet had is a front-facing camera. I downloaded a free app to turn on the tablet camera and I can easily take photos of myself or whatever is behind me. Taking photos of what is in front of me is not impossible - just requires me to turn around, get my head out of the shot, and snap - but it's not convenient. Otherwise I'm a happy Nexus 7 tablet user!

Reviews.Title: DISAPPOINTING ,i feel abandoned
Reviews.Author: perdobuc
Reviews.Content: My daugther bought 7 months ago you first tablet(Google nexus 7), but the tablet malfunctioned 2 months later,the battery never charged to 100%,2 weeks ago is shutdown and i called to technical support for warranty and toll me that because i am in Latinoamérica the coverage no apply,here in colombia the authorized center of asus i must pay 50 u$ only for look it,and they are not sure that will can repair.conclusion is lost,nobody support

Reviews.Title: This thing sucks!
Reviews.Author: Travis Okada
Reviews.Content: When it works, it works great. When it sucks, it sucks hard. I find myself constantly charging the stupid thing even if I don't use it all that much. I don't take it out at all it pretty much is a home tablet. It shuts off randomly and then I have the hardest time getting it to restart. I looked up fixes on Google and even though some of the fixes work. Why the hell do I have to do these stupid fixes to get it to work all the time? It's more of a hack then a fix. Hold the power button down, hold the volume button. Stupid. That's some shoddy product right there. I bought this thing in Feb this year and it's only August now. The year isn't even over and it's already crapping out. Because I bought this through a third party dealer, returns are only good for 90 days. Thanks a lot!

Reviews.Title: Very good tablet
Reviews.Author: danw2016
Reviews.Content: The Nexus 7 is a pritty good tablet. I watch movies and plays lots of apps. Unlike other tablets I have had, this one does not crash often. I also like the long battery life that it has. The only complaint I have is it takes a while to boot up. But, I would recommend this to anyone who needs a tablet.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Tablet for $ spent.
Reviews.Author: William J. Phillips "tool maker"
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy my Nexus 7; it has handled everything I have asked it to do so far. Wish ithad a SD card slot.

Reviews.Title: Great Purchase
Reviews.Author: Karen A. Reynolds "booklover"
Reviews.Content: This tablet is easy to use.  I love doing face time with my granddaughter.Wish it had a larger screen.

Reviews.Title: Not all Nexus 7s are created equal
Reviews.Author: Jorge Munoz-Bustamante "L.C.S.W."
Reviews.Content: I bought a Nexus 7 from Office Depot 20 days ago and the auto rotation feature stopped functioning. Since the 14 day return policy from Office Depot had expired I called Google and they began to resolve the issue: they tried a software fix and immediately offered a replacement when the problem wasn't resolved. They would charge my card for the new Nexus, ship it, and when they received the old one they would credit the amount. Sensible and straightforward. When I got the RMA I noticed that they were referring to a previous Nexus that I bought for a family member. When I notified them they advised me that this had to be resolved with Asus. This was a radically different experience. With them you have to send the machine, wait for them to determine the cause of a problem, then if it's their fault they will repair it and send it back. "Normally this takes 5-7 business days but if parts aren't available it could take longer" basically as long as they need to get the part which could be weeks days or months.The 1 star rating was because the machine stopped working after only 14 days and the customer support service was nowhere near what is reasonable from a company that's trying to compete with Apple.The takeaway is that Nexus is not a Google brand and that if you want Google service you need to stick with Google Play. Google would be wise to either separate the Nexus name from Asus or make sure that their service level matches Google.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Edward
Reviews.Content: I wanted something good for skype, couple movies, games, and reading.I love the book/magazine from the google play store. So far only put a couple gigs on itbut i wish that there was a way to put sd memory in it or usb. overal i gove it a 9/10

Reviews.Title: Headphone jack doesn't work and return policy is too short
Reviews.Author: Ned Fraser
Reviews.Content: The return policy for this device is too short.I bought this for Mother's Day. We didn't try the headphone jack until we went on a trip. My wife tried many headphones thinking it was the headphones never thinking it was the jack. All of our headphones work on the other tech devices. She is very disappointed that she can't use the headphones. We're very happy with the device with this major exception.

Reviews.Title: Asus Nexus 7 Tablet
Reviews.Author: Critic
Reviews.Content: I bought this used and the seller said that he had taken good care of it and he was right. He had kept it in a case that protected it and it wasn't scratched, scuffed or anything. Works just fine.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT!!
Reviews.Author: HONDA "GEMINITWINWORLD"
Reviews.Content: i looove this tablet i just need a cover and enjoy no complaints from me..how ever no usb slot or memory slot for cardsno worrys its for movies and games anyway im happy.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic tablet
Reviews.Author: Cosmic
Reviews.Content: Very fast handy and neat thing wich fits all my and my family expectations. My wife use it with huge pleasure for her purposes, my sonny just love it for gaming.

Reviews.Title: Love it, Love it, Love it.
Reviews.Author: Cynthia A. Staggs "avid buyer"
Reviews.Content: I had held off buying a tablet but when my husband started chemo I needed something to occupy me for the 4-5+ hours I was there with him.  I asked my computer savvy grandson which tablet he liked and it was hands down the Nexus 7.  I chose to get it in Wi-Fi only as the chemo therapy room was set up for us that way and I don't like being on computers, tablets or phones that much. I was happy I could get my Kindle library on this tablet and now barely use my Kindle paper white.  Love this tablet and it is small enough that I can put it in my purse and take it with me almost anywhere that I will need to spend a lot of downtime.  I would recommend this to anyone even those like me who are not used to using tablets.  Easy to use and get addicted to!  My husband definitely did not want a tablet and I had it a few days before he broke down and decided to play some games I had downloaded and now I have to share time with him to use it.  Guess we will be getting another one later.

Reviews.Title: Disappointing performance, poor user interface
Reviews.Author: Lewis Barrett
Reviews.Content: I had puzzled over buying a tablet and held off for several years but an extended, long haul motorcycle trip made my decision for me as I wanted to pack light but have a bit more ease of access to the internet and my email than might be afforded by a smart phone yet not have to carry my laptop with me.  I settled on the Nexus 7 as the best value for money and bought one locally at a reputable chain office supply outlet.  The first unit I received was DOA and would not charge or boot up.  Staples was kind enough to take it back and give me a second device on the spot.  I've now had it for ten days and my verdict is in: this device is next to useless and extremely frustrating to use.The touch screen is exceptionally unresponsive and because the wifi receiver is so weak, a great deal of the battery power is used in simply trying to communicate with the router so that estimates of battery time are wildly exaggerated by the manufacturer.  This device has very poor connectivity, and to make matters worse, the touch screen has terribly functionality. It seems to have a mind of its own and is sometimes sensitive to the tiny inputs, even just a bit of motion, while at others  it is insensitive to the ones you want it to respond to.  Frequently you can get two thirds of the way through a letter or document only to find the unit has dropped out and all your work has been lost.  Mine has a nasty habit of returning to the home screen just as I am about to complete a document.  I put this up largely to the poor response of the screen that makes typing difficult and inaccurate.  There are other annoyances that have already been mentioned, but the poor connectivity, mediocre battery life and miserable screen functionality are my main peeves.  Having to return a DOA from a fresh box was not encouraging as well as it spoke poorly of the manufacturer's quality control. I'd like to say you get what you pay for with the Nexus 7, but in fact, nice as the packaging is, you actually get less than that. It is so frustrating to use (I'm no geek but far from computer illiterate) that for me it actually has no value at all.  It is clear I will have to spend a bit more to get a reliable, user friendly and robust tablet, and when I get home from my trip later this week, that's exactly what I intend to do. This review has been typed on a borrowed Macbook Pro as I seriously doubt if a message this long could easily be completed on my particular Nexus 7.

Reviews.Title: Google Rocks!
Reviews.Author: Jaffray Rhett
Reviews.Content: I love the tablet. I wish it had been refurbished by Google. They are a class act. Whomever handled the refurbishing & sale, not in the same ballpark. No warrantee, no instructions, no written material at all, like buying used equipment, a tablet and charge cable in a box, that's it. We know the Nexus 7, have an 8 gig for a while now, no problem.

Reviews.Title: Better then my IPad
Reviews.Author: Annie Espinal
Reviews.Content: Brought it for my 10 year old son he loves it. He cant get enough he can dowload books play games and even surf the net for school project information.

Reviews.Title: For what I use it for, it's awesome.
Reviews.Author: ffancy
Reviews.Content: Some crazy lady the other day saw my tablet and was like, "You should get an ipad." Seriously? I JUST bought this thing, and I LOVE it. And why the hell would I spend 100 bucks more for something that isn't compatible with the devices I already own? That's just dumb. Dumb lady, awesome tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Shelley "just me"
Reviews.Content: I like this Google's version of an iPad.  I've had it for a few months and still learning all the features.  It didn't have a detailed instruction manual or features.... but you can find it all online.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7 Tablet just the one
Reviews.Author: B. Hamer
Reviews.Content: I play a game called Ingress - uses an android tablet connected to my I phone.The tablet is larger than an android phone, so I can see it easily as I am walking along.Longer battery life is extended with the use of an external one or two. Easy to see, easy to use,great buy.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied with this little tablet...
Reviews.Author: Jacque
Reviews.Content: I  bought this tablet for my husband and he loves it. It  was  in near perfect condition and the seller really went out of his way to make sure I received it in time for his birthday. it  was a very pleasant transaction.

Reviews.Title: More than what I expected
Reviews.Author: Joomla Electronics
Reviews.Content: I love it. It's so fast and reliable with apps. Streaming is tremendous. I can watch all my favorite channels and videos from YouTube. The camera is so awesome. Charging is so efficient. VoIP apps are amazing on it. Games are so smooth and fast. Love this tablet. I would recommend buying this device over any other tablet in the world.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful mini tablet
Reviews.Author: ulianne
Reviews.Content: Android runs very smoothly and this tablet is the perfect size for ereading, web use, and productivity. Definitely glad I bought this rather than the Amazon Kindle, because there is much more freedom. Light, beautiful, and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: S.A.
Reviews.Content: Love my tablet, though I didn't end up using it as much as I thought I would (consumer error). It's light, fits in my regular day purse, and the battery life is wonderfully long even if you're watching videos. Would recommend to anyone in the market for a tablet but is on a budget-- this is the best bang for your buck compared to the iPad

Reviews.Title: GOOGLE NEXUS 7 TABLET
Reviews.Author: KUHLENBECK,LILLIE J
Reviews.Content: Lightening fast internet surfing, graphics crisp and clear.  Very happy with this tablet.  Does everything a laptop does at a fraction of the cost of a laptop.  My husband and I each have a Nexis 7 tablet.  Would be lost without it.  My highest 5 star reccomendation!

Reviews.Title: Best 7 Inch Tablet
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: my 84 year old dad loves this efficient and eay to handle tablet. he hardly turns on his pc anymore.

Reviews.Title: Good Price
Reviews.Author: Veridiana
Reviews.Content: It's an amazing product, considering the price, but I expected more about the finishing. I already had an iPad and its impossible not to compare both. I think Google could improve more on next version.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: clytn
Reviews.Content: I love the smaller screen. 10inch was too big for me. Does everything any other tablet can do. Charge lasts a good amount of time.

Reviews.Title: nexys7
Reviews.Author: lola13
Reviews.Content: For what my daughter wanted to do with this it as met all expectations. I would definitely buy this product again.

Reviews.Title: Nexas 7
Reviews.Author: Jac
Reviews.Content: I recieved my tablet on time and it was package nicely. I use it to connect my music to my bose system. I also plan to take it on my future trip to Italy  for the plane ride.

Reviews.Title: great first tablet
Reviews.Author: Dragos Seghete
Reviews.Content: This was our family's first  tablet experience  and we're pretty happy with it. The stock Google nexus mode allows for great integration with other google products and sync with our laptops and phones.  Having dual user accounts is awesome. Hardware itself is well built, pretty snappy, but haven't bogged it down with apps yet. Battery life could be better.

Reviews.Title: The world at your command
Reviews.Author: charles pullens
Reviews.Content: This item is very well made.  Everything that you need for work or play.  Congratulations Google for a job well done

Reviews.Title: love it.
Reviews.Author: Jared Bennett
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect tablet. Size is great and works great. However battery life is not nearly as good as my old ipad. Of course its much lighter and smaller. I bought it because it was so painfully slow to search the internet on my ipad. This is not lighting fast but 10 times faster than my gen 1 ipad. I still use my ipad to watch all my youtube subscriptions and use this to search the internet while watching t.v. For the price you cant beat it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome device
Reviews.Author: NS
Reviews.Content: I struggled over buying this given something better is around the bend. However, it looks beautiful, runs smooth, and I use it daily for everyday tasks. I can't bring myself to buying anything that isn't stock android again. I'm sold on the next phone they release.Browsing is slick, animation is smooth, feels great in your hand, battery goes forever. Only con is if you really load it, it will struggle.

Reviews.Title: sooooo gooooood!!! like it so much, it works well and convenient  for outing!!!
Reviews.Author: Bei
Reviews.Content: I choose it because I can't afford a I pad. The truth proves it is worthy. it is light, and really fit my need. however the battery can't last  that long! I always take the charger with me^-^

Reviews.Title: AWESOME!
Reviews.Author: Dylan R.
Reviews.Content: I love the user friendlyness of the tablet. I think all the complaints of the apps are rediculous. Ive found everything I need and more! I have already recomended the tablet to my grandpa because of how easy it is to learn. Awesome product!

Reviews.Title: Bought it, took it back 2 days later
Reviews.Author: Jason Giambrone
Reviews.Content: First day everything was fine worked great. Second day got the Jelly Bean update and I immediately started having trouble with the wireless connection. My iPad and my laptop were working fine as well as the rest of my wireless devices. I disabled NFC feature as other people had done and that seemed help. The next day, no wireless at all, nothing, nada. I eventually found an android forum where other people are having the same problem. I should have known an ASUS product would have issues and Google never seems to stand behind their branded hardware. All the tech magazine sites had such rave reviews about this but it's clear they are clueless. Save up by Apple or at least avoid ASUS!

Reviews.Title: Google Nexus 7 tablet
Reviews.Author: DAMON MARSHBURN
Reviews.Content: I like this tablet synced everything very quickly and kept my info from apps that were loaded on my phone which enabled me to delete them so that I could save my phones battery life.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: Outstanding and I love the fact I can now play my games on this and not have to mess up my Android phone with games.

Reviews.Title: Best 7" Tablet
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best Tablet. Its 199 $. Has the tegra 3. I would recommend this over the Tab 3, Kindle Fire, and nook. It is fast and doesn't lag at all. Don't buy at amazon because you can pick it up for 199 $ at staples and office depot.

Reviews.Title: not as good as the iPad
Reviews.Author: TM
Reviews.Content: Found that many of the apps that I use on my iPad either aren't available or aren't free on the Nexus.  Returned it.  If you haven't gotten use to the iPad, it's probably fine.

Reviews.Title: waste of time and your patience
Reviews.Author: david
Reviews.Content: wonderful if you can get it to turn on. and if you can get it to charge and hold a charge. which it dont do well. plug it in and nothing happens. go to use it and it is DEAD classic piece of crap will seek to get a full refund.garbage!

Reviews.Title: Incredible product
Reviews.Author: Rosemarie W. Tyson
Reviews.Content: Easy to use. Syncs well with Google accounts. Smooth transitioning between applications. Application download using Google Play was very easy.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet, good price
Reviews.Author: R. Beeler
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with my purchase.  The price is higher than what you pay through Google directly, however if you received a gift card (as I did) this is fine.

Reviews.Title: Really like it until...
Reviews.Author: Jim Acquisto
Reviews.Content: It went dead.  No charge, no power.  Sending it back to ASUS.  We will see what they say, should be under warranty.

Reviews.Title: Fine Purchased
Reviews.Author: ANTONIO ARSLANIAN
Reviews.Content: At this moment I can say I made a great purchased, I also have a Samsung Galaxy Nexus and i could sync all my data with this tab... I highly recommend it for galaxy users

Reviews.Title: My Google Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: Brianna
Reviews.Content: I just bought the nexus 7 for taking notes in class, and it's great! I downloaded the mircrosoft word/powerpoint/excel app, and it works great. Of course I had to buy the attachable keyboard separately, but I love it. Great Buy, and the quality of video through my Netflix Instant account is better than my laptop.

Reviews.Title: love it!!!!
Reviews.Author: karen
Reviews.Content: I use it all the time. Still learning. Not real crazy about the camera. Very awkward to use. But. Other than that I love it

Reviews.Title: awesome tablet!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Elio R. Plascencia
Reviews.Content: such a great tablet. very user friendly and use it for just about everything i need to look up. my fiance and i would be at a loss without it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Efrain Perez
Reviews.Content: Google did it again! what a nice tablet!!! and i came with the 4.2.2. jellybean version, wich allows me to make a session apart to my wife

Reviews.Title: The Best
Reviews.Author: Felix Millan
Reviews.Content: the best tablet I bought, good design and especially many applications for Android, a great tablet and very good price

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Warren Bell
Reviews.Content: Just as fast and smooth as my Galaxy Note II also with a quad core processor and jelly bean. This is strictly google software, not a bunch of bloatware like carriers add

Reviews.Title: Exelente
Reviews.Author: Arik Jara
Reviews.Content: buena tablet, cumple con todos mis requsitos, Exelente producto, cumple con la especificaciones requeridas, me llego dentro del tiempo ofrecido, el vendedor cumplio con todo lo requerido

Reviews.Title: I wanted to like this thing
Reviews.Author: Hickory Shampoo
Reviews.Content: I purchased this here on Amazon, thinking with the Asus and Google behind it, it must be pretty decent. Unfortunately, the wrinkles I've been waiting for them to iron out haven't been addressed.My main complaint is with its ability to handle simple tasks without freezing, lagging or downright crashing. I monitor the RAM load and try to stay on top of unnecessary apps running in the background, but none of this seems to help. Even as I tap out this review, I'm several words ahead before it catches up (I'm not a fast typist on tablets). I liken it to the overdramatic girlfriend who spazzes out over all the pressure when there's really no pressure at all. I should be able to browse Facebook or the internet (via Chrome; it's the native browser, FFS) without hangups. Alas, it's all too much to handle, I guess, but so she's locked herself in the bathroom until I give up and reboot.The display looks magnificent, but it has lately had phantom activations. It is as if it thinks I'm pressing on the screen when I'm not. Links magically get clicked or sections of text get highlighted for no reason. Maybe I'm being followed by a mischievous ghost. Or, more likely, the tablet is just bad.When I decided on it last year, I knew it didn't have a backward-facing camera. I didn't think it would be that big a deal. Well, it is more of a deal than I thought. Several times, it would've been handy to have for FB or Instagram when my phone wasn't an option. And you can't use Amazon's app - it won't even load, due to the lack of that backward-facing camera.I think I've had enough of it's shenanigans and will look at replacing it in the coming weeks. Might go with a iPad or another, more-stable Android platform. My advice to potential buyers: save yourself the heartache and look at something else.

Reviews.Title: So good I bought one as a gift
Reviews.Author: Yep
Reviews.Content: I have one as my personal device and have had it since November of 2012. It is now April of 2013 and it works well, in fact, I ordered one as a birthday gift for a family member and she loves it too.Mine has survived a few minor falls and sneezes. The only thing I don't like is trying to find a true ASUS case for it. I was lucky and found one relatively easily locally (and I live in rural BFE). Also, the packaging for the one I have and the one I bought as a gift smells like gun powder, they must be packaged in a fireworks plant.Other than that, Google and ASUS delivered. I typed this review from mine

Reviews.Title: Defective unity and ASUS customer support is terrible
Reviews.Author: Mike J
Reviews.Content: I received this unit as a gift from a business partner.  I loved it out of the box but after 2 days it died.  I was traveling and so I tossed the box before going home to take up less space.  There was a sticker on the back that I also removed.  BIG MISTAKE!  If your unit is defective (which apparently is common from reading these reviews) then you need the serial number. There are three ways to get the serial number: 1. Off the box, 2. Through the system (if it's working), or 3. The sticker on the back.I called ASUS support which is overseas and after an hour of working with them was told that I was out of luck.  No serial number, no service.  I was livid since it's a brand new unit.  I asked for a manager and was put on hold for a half hour before finally giving up.  I called back a week later and the new rep Claude was a bit more helpful.  He got me an RMA and I overnighted my unit to Texas for service.  They say after 24 hours of receiving the unit you can track it online.  It's now been 5 days and I called back and they are saying they haven't received it.  I gave them the tracking number and the name of who signed for the unit.We'll see where this goes, but best case they get me a new unit that works in the next week.  Even if that's the case, this is a one-star unit based on the defective unit and terrible service.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet For The Price
Reviews.Author: William R. Davis
Reviews.Content: Nice size for most apps and display is very good. Wide variety of apps are available OS is very stable. Good battery life.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love it
Reviews.Author: Jasmine
Reviews.Content: I loved it the first day I started using it. The screen is wonderful and Google Now makes it even more a pleasant gadget to have. I would definitely recommend it. My only issue with it, and not a big one, is the fact that the usb port cannot read external usb drives like my other Android tablet. I also wished there is a camera on the back. Other than those two this tablet is by far the best 7inch there is. A must buy.

Reviews.Title: do not buy this tablet
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Johnson
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom and after two months the tablet would not charge or turn on.  very unhappy with Google.  I am in the process of sending it back now!

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: Jeshua
Reviews.Content: This tablet has amazing graphics for its cheap price i would diffidently choose this over an iPad mini for its price and this uses Google i really like this.

Reviews.Title: great tablet for general media and e-reader.
Reviews.Author: William Smith
Reviews.Content: I like the android platform.  Its very conforming to my needs.  I us it for news, video, books (nook and kindle), some web browsing, email, blogging, and schedule work and home.  For me, I love it.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive and fantastic
Reviews.Author: Anthony Shine
Reviews.Content: For the price, the best tablet you can get. Battery life is exceptional for an Android tablet and it feels very hasty.

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Turoczi Attila
Reviews.Content: Simply good the way it is. The only thing I miss is passwords for the user accounts, but perhaps that's Google's job to provide. Otherwise I like its fast responsiveness and good materials, discrete elegance.

Reviews.Title: Battery Problem
Reviews.Author: SB
Reviews.Content: when i first got it i loved my nexus but now its becomin very frsutrating to charge it every day for like 4 -5 hours. if i am playing games then this get discharged in less than 6 hours. i dont know if this is a defect or what.

Reviews.Title: Does what a tablet should do.
Reviews.Author: Dobos András
Reviews.Content: Basically what you expct from a tablet: fast, reasonable battery, no extra junk like GSM. No issues with it so far either, though using CyanogenMod is highly recommended to get the full experience.The only downside is the lack of MicroSD slot and no dedicated HDMI slot.I'd recommend the 32GB variant.

Reviews.Title: Google Nexus 7
Reviews.Author: Jane E.
Reviews.Content: Very small and convenient size. Very easy to set up. Easy to take with me.There are programs like Evernote that help keep meconnected. I like it very much!!!

Reviews.Title: Googles tablet
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet!  It's powerful,  clean,  and pure Google.No bloatware at all and is price is right.The only problem I have with this is there is no micro card support.  I understand why but still, that socks.  I also believe that Internet service should be optional for all devices.  Overall this is a great tablet.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Nice!
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: I traded in my 10" Toshiba Thrive for this baby and I'm glad I did.  I was looking for something more portable to use at work (my job has a lot of down time where I can read or listen to music, etc.) and this has fit the bill perfectly.  My favorite feature is that I can connect to the internet via the Bluetooth connection on my phone, so I almost exclusively use my Nexus 7 at work to do online activities.  The price was a huge selling point for me as well, and I feel I have gotten a lot of bang for my buck.

Reviews.Title: not bad
Reviews.Author: Alice
Reviews.Content: this is my second tablet after an archos 70 which got old too quick. the nexus is lighter and much more powerful, the processor with quad core is great, however not having any expansion via sd is a real drawback

Reviews.Title: Satisfied owner
Reviews.Author: Manuel
Reviews.Content: I  bought this when it first went on the market . It is awesome i love itIf you're looking for a tablet look no further this is it

Reviews.Title: Product as stated.
Reviews.Author: Sha
Reviews.Content: Works great as stated, very pleased.  I bought this for my ten year old grandson and he is using it to study and do school work on.  He also has his games downloaded along with his music, he is very pleased.

Reviews.Title: just the right combination
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It's a great device, the size is very convinient for transportation without limiting the amount of stuff one can do with it and the price is quite perfect.

Reviews.Title: amazing tablet!
Reviews.Author: Nelson Sanchez "say no more"
Reviews.Content: this is a very well known and consolidated product on the market. I bought it for my nieces as a present and they have been using it everyday for the latest 5 months. Best gift ever I will say.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic device
Reviews.Author: Stephen/Stacey
Reviews.Content: First tablet I've ever owned. It was a choice between this and the iPad Mini. I of course chose the Nexus 7. No problems, no regrets. Looking forward to the next Nexus 7 tablet to be released.

Reviews.Title: This is it!
Reviews.Author: Grandpa Dennis
Reviews.Content: It does everything I need in a tablet. Great! It has pretty much replaced my PC for everyday usage. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Mark Montgomery
Reviews.Content: Fast, light, and completely customizable. I find that nearly every app I have on iOS is also here in the android marketplace.

Reviews.Title: Very nice
Reviews.Author: Daniel Szekely
Reviews.Content: Just as expected. Good build quality. Fast. Responsive. Excellent screen. Good as a reader and media device. Bravo Google!...and ASUS;)

Reviews.Title: Better than Galaxy 7
Reviews.Author: Matt Kurmas
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 7" for $180. I was not pleased with the screen res, the build, the Android version, proprietary apps, . I have a smartphone with an HD display (Razr HD)and it looks great. After using the Galaxy for a few I noticed how badly the pixels stood out everywhere. I could not get past the non HD display, it's ugly. After one day of use it also seemed to run a bit slow and had a few other minor quirks. I knew I would not be happy with it for the long termAfter some additional research I switched to the Nexus 7 and I am very pleased to have done so. The display is beautiful. It runs better with the better processor and Android 4.2.2. All Google all the way is perfect for me.If you buy a Nexus over a Galaxy you will be giving up the camera and SD expansion slot.I am able to live with this since I have way too many cameras already. I also do not store a lot on my devices so 16G will be adequate. There are also ways to stream music and video from a flash drive using app Nexus Media Importer and a USB OTG cable.[...]So, the Nexus is much a nicer tablet for only $20 more. If you are debating between the two, now you know where I stand.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet. Highly Recommend.
Reviews.Author: Hayden
Reviews.Content: I got my Google Nexus 7 tablet through Groupon a while back, and love it. The operating software is great and all of the apps work just fine. I don't like the way Google Chrome looks when searching the internet, but it works perfectly fine. Battery life is really good too.The casing and backing are great. Easy to hold onto and it won't slip out of your hands.The only issues I have with the tablet are minor, but they are still there. Some apps (The Washington Post app for example) are not compatible with my tablet. Also, The Hockey News app constantly crashes. While the first one is due to the tablet and it's software, the other is likely the app itself.I would have liked a spot to input an micro SD card. The more expensive models have that. I'm not sure how difficult that would have been to put on there, but it would have been nice. Especially since there is only 16 GB's of memory.I don't like that there is no camera on the back. While I would mostly use my cell phone or digital camera for taking pictures, it would have been nice to have one. Especially with apps like Skype or for taking photos around the house.The last issue I have is creating a wallpaper. Some pictures I use come up looking stretched out. Perhaps this is user error, but if not that could be a little better. Still a very minor issue.Overall, I think this is a great 7 inch tablet. I got the Skytex Alpha 2 a year or so before and it is no where near as good as the Nexus 7. With the Alpha 2, apps wouldn't work, and after a while the tablet would no longer download apps. I have had no software issues with the Nexus 7, or minor convenience ones. I would highly recommend getting one.

Reviews.Title: My grand child says it perfect, and he knows about it.
Reviews.Author: Pilar Gonzalez Parra
Reviews.Content: He found what he need out from a tablet , and i found a very reasonable price. So, both persons happy.

Reviews.Title: Works fairly well but no Wifi-N
Reviews.Author: M. Dillon
Reviews.Content: I would rate it four stars if not for the severe misrepresentation of its wifi capabilities.  I got it, the tech specs said it could do wifi-N ... but it can't, not at 5GHz.  I consider it a severe misrepresentation because the whole point of the N specification was to have that 5GHz band that doesn't interfere with bluetooth.  They should not advertise wifi-N capabilities without 5GHz, period.Another serious issue is that the display doesn't hold a candle to an ipad or ipad-mini.  It's only 'ok'.  Partly because the display pixels themselves are quite soft, but also because most of the video apps (netflix, youtube) appear to to be upscaling lower-rez video streams instead of providing the correctly-sized stream.  A good chunk of this problem is likely related to the lack of consistency with android tablets in general (something you just don't have with Apple devices), but I also think the display technology leaves something to be desired in this device.For a quad-cpu device it's not as snappy as the ipad mini.  Most of the time those extra cpus just don't have anything to do, and most apps are going to be single-threaded anyway so it's a bit of a waste.  Still plenty fast enough for all use cases though.The lack of secondary storage is well known so not really a detriment for review purposes.  I still find myself wanting it, though.  I am loath to ask Dogcatcher to cycle a hundred megabytes of storage each day from auto downloads onto internal non-replaceable storage.Other than that it works as advertised.-Matt

Reviews.Title: GOGGLE NEXUS 7 TABLET
Reviews.Author: Ana I Acevedo
Reviews.Content: THIS IS A GOOD PRODUCT AND I GIVE IT TO MY SON.  HE IS VERY PLEASE WITH IT.  FILL ALL THE EXPECTATIONS.  I SHARE IT WITH OTHERS.

Reviews.Title: I love this thing
Reviews.Author: Michael Shaw
Reviews.Content: I truly do. I use this thing daily everywhere I go. It has a great screen resolution and many features. I never thought I would depend on a mobile device but I have been lately. Definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great Small Tablet, Even better price.
Reviews.Author: Kevin Andersen
Reviews.Content: First of all, I am a huge Apple fan however wanted/needed a device for multiple users, which led me to the nexus 7. I havent used an android device since my first Droid X and am impressed with how it has come. The tablet has a great feel to it, sturdy, sharp screen, and is pretty quick. I honestly like this device far better than my Kindle Fire 8.9" HD. I reccommend this tablet to anyone looking for a 7" tablet.

Reviews.Title: It was basically brand new
Reviews.Author: Anthony  Delamora
Reviews.Content: I love how fast it got shipped, the best bang for my buck and since its made by Google I get updates asap! You can never go wrong with a nexus 7 :).BTW I highly recommend this guy! Great seller 100% trustworthy!!

Reviews.Title: Have fun, or get things done--either way
Reviews.Author: Brian J. Warshaw
Reviews.Content: The following is a reflection of how I use my Nexus 7. I'm not a gamer, so I don't have too much of a problem with games coming to Android second. I don't need all of the latest apps, and I have a set of specific things that I generally do, all of which I have apps for, so I haven't really felt the impact of the Android tablet app disparity. I understand that these things matter to lots of folks, so take what I say with a grain of salt and try to determine if I seem like the sort of user that you are.HAVING FUN:Like most folks, the bulk of my tablet usage is for leisure purposes--browsing the web, connecting to Facebook and Twitter, playing simple games, reading. The Nexus 7 does a great job at all of these things. The screen is beautiful, and it makes all of these tasks a pleasure.Tech journalists will pick on the Facebook app's "blown-up phone" experience, since there are no features taking advantage of the tablet's size, but in practical use, this doesn't really cause any problems. Could it be better and slicker by targeting larger screens? Sure. But it's something I would like if it was there, but never miss when it's not.There are a few really good Twitter (and App.net, if you go that way) apps. My two favorites are Carbon and Falcon Pro. Be warned, however, that Falcon is already having problems with Twitter's user token limit (totally on Twitter's side, but still), and once Carbon adds some more features and corrects some bugs, it will likely reach its limit quickly, as well. The advantage that iOS has here is that it had a number of quality Twitter apps prior to the Twitter usage changes, which ultimately gave those apps a much higher user limit than a client just starting out. The two Android apps I've mentioned really do represent the best Twitter user experience on Android, and they are both young, which means their potential for a larger userbase is not there.There are a lot of great games on Android. Popular titles like Jetpack Joyride, Cut the Rope (and Pudding Monsters!!), Angry Birds--all here. I also play adventure and puzzle games, like Machinarium (sweet, sweet game) or Tiny Bang Story. Waking Mars, Swords and Sworcery--all here.Chrome is a great browser on any platform, and it really doesn't disappoint on the Nexus 7. Not a whole lot of new stuff to be said here.Reading with the Kindle app is fantastic. Reading with the Google Play Books app is less fantastic, but honestly, unless you're a die-hard googler, what are the chances that you've purchased a bunch of books from the Play Store?I also do a good bit of Bible reading on my device, and my top app for that is The Bible App from YouVersion. I have some qualms, and would much prefer if the ESV Bible App would be optimized for a tablet (and honestly, improved for Android overall).GETTING THINGS DONE:Here's where I was very unexpectedly surprised by the Nexus 7. I got it, like most people, expecting to use it for fun, and maybe some app development experiments. What I have found, on multiple occasions, is how useful this thing is as an assistant for getting things done.On the first day, we had a Bible study at our house. In preparation for that, I decided to try using the Nexus. I have the Bible app, after all, as well as Evernote and Google Docs.This past week, I was getting quotes for and scheduling a home inspection. I called with my phone, and took notes with the Nexus.In both of these instances, I was amazed at how easy the Nexus made it. There are two chief factors, as I see it, that make it so:1. Android multitasking. In Android, you always have a dedicated button onscreen (or on device) for multitasking. You tap it once, and you see a list of app thumbnails. Seeing those app thumbnails (instead of just icons) is a great brain-aid. Instead of having to recognize an app by its icon, you get to see what you were doing before you left the app. Also, only needing to tap once makes it a cinch to very quickly get to the list, and, in the case of the Nexus 7, since the multitasking button is software, onscreen, it can't wear out like a hardware button. So if you wore out the home button on your i-device (which I did on two iPhones), this might actually be a huge factor for you.2. Android 4.2+. Android 4.2 introduced swipe-typing to the built-in keyboard. This is a massive help. While calling home inspectors, I had my phone in my left hand, my tablet on my lap, and my right hand pointer finger typing up a storm using the swipe typing. If you aren't familiar with the concept, you put your finger down and move it to the letters of your desired word, only lifting when you want to end a word. It is ridiculously useful, and very forgiving. I don't have to aim for amazing precision, because it does a fantastic job of interpreting what you're trying to do. I also used the swiping to take notes in church this past Sunday, and I was able to jot stuff down quickly and get back to listening.SUMMARY:The wisdom of the tech journalists seems to be that smaller tablets are meant to be great consumption devices, whereas larger tablets and "real computers" are better for getting stuff done. The Nexus 7 is great for consumption, but it's most pleasant surprise is how great it is for accomplishing real things. It's definitely worth a look. You might just end up loving it like I do.

Reviews.Title: Good for purchase
Reviews.Author: Ramón Bravo.-
Reviews.Content: Very nice and reliable equipment it's covered so far all the expectations I had with it ! I personally recommend it

Reviews.Title: Not bad... I am still learning
Reviews.Author: A Mangiavacchi
Reviews.Content: But it would have been much better if the product shipped with instructions and/or a user manual! On the other hand, it is far cheaper than overrated Ipad

Reviews.Title: Amazing Affordable Tablet!!
Reviews.Author: Superior Android
Reviews.Content: I choose this over the Fire HD, because it's a Nexus! Google updates and Google support. Plus it has a Quad Core Processor! The USB OTG support is also huge plus.It's Super Genuine,It's Super Fast,It's Super Affordable,

Reviews.Title: Awesome Tablet
Reviews.Author: Austin
Reviews.Content: This is the perfect 7-inch tablet. The OS is so smooth, the screen is amazingly sharp, and the processor is lightning fast. Having dealt with iPad minis also, this tablet beats it in just about every category.Another thing I love about this tablet is the battery life. I can use it for two days without charging it if I manage it good. And this thing goes with me everywhere because it is the perfect size. It easily fonts into my back pocket.I would reccomend this to just about everyone! You should defenitely give this little guy a try!

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Tony
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the Google Nexus 7.  Fast, powerful and sleek.  I have not come close to unlocking all the features yet.  No issues with screen or failures as reported by other users.  I don't use a case or screen protector either.

Reviews.Title: Best 7 tables for the moment
Reviews.Author: Carlos Salazar
Reviews.Content: I've been using this table for 4 months without issues so far, it is faster and always responses quickly even playing games, doing web surfing or watching hd videos, so far I haven't noticed any problem with it as I said before. if you want to play games and navigate on internet this tables is for you, otherwise look around for other models since this one cannot use SD cards, it means that 16GB is not enough these days. you'll probably need more memory soon which is frustrating using the OTG cable.Pros:FasterNice resolution.tons of apps.Cons:Poor facetime camera.no SD slot.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Tech
Reviews.Author: Dan J.
Reviews.Content: I love the Nexus 7.  The embedded Tegra 4 chip is absoultely perfect for gaming.  The display is beautiful, not to mention I think it's the perfect size for portability, reading, and viewing just about any media.  Asus has managed to package a beautiful display and powerful processor into an affordable package that I couldn't have loved more.  It did, however, crash, a couple of weeks after I received it.  Dealing with Asus was relatively easy, but the product did break nonetheless, so I can't give it a full five stars unfortunately.

Reviews.Title: Great device!
Reviews.Author: Joshua Storme King
Reviews.Content: My wife couldn't live without it! She only has ONE complaint... no rear facing camera. Other than that, this is in her hands every moment of every day. Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Free of fire
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "mgurin"
Reviews.Content: Part of what I love of nexus 7 is the price I paid. I traded in my original Kindle fire at Gamestop and got $100 trade in on a brand new 32gb nexus 7. Then we discovered box seal was broken so was given an extra 20% off! So I paid about $100 for a state of the art android tablet. Trading in? Go to gamestop's website.I won't make comparisons to ipad because I don't have one and because that's not the target of this device. Completely open android environment is amazing after being locked into the heavily curated amazon world. I can do everything on n7 that I could with kindle fire. Amazon prime video? Yup. Kindle books? Yup. Go to YouTube and do some research and within 15 minutes you will have a nexus 7 that can stream flash video, play amazon videos, etc. I use this for everything now. Be sure to buy SwiftKey keyboard app and the right cover. I bought a bluetooth keyboard but SwiftKey is so good and Google voice to text is so accurate i don't use it much. anyway, the n7 exceeds my expectations in every way.

Reviews.Title: Great Device.
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: Have two of these units and no problems from either one. Easy to use and I love the fact that it sync with Andriod phone seemlessly. I wish it was more compatible with the NFL mobile...Great buy!

Reviews.Title: needs input microphone control
Reviews.Author: tcolgan "tcolgan"
Reviews.Content: Google Nexus 7 is a great product for the price, but with one major flaw which needs to be corrected.The input microphone is not adjustable which makes it next to useless as a recording device.And there is no way to use an external mike (audio,usb or bluetooth).A super app exists - Audio Evolution - for doing multitrack recording.  But it is next to useless due to this limitation imposed by google.  When will it be fixed?

Reviews.Title: Google Nexus 7 Tablet
Reviews.Author: Carolyn K. Hansen
Reviews.Content: I really like my new tablet. It is really easy to use. I have one thought though. It states there is a front view camera but I still have not found out how it works. Is there an app to download first.

Reviews.Title: Love it ! Best small tablet available.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Why be limited by a nook or a kindle fire or the walled garden of Apple and ios when you can have the newest version of android and do most everything the others can do but a lot more ...no issues with the hardware... I think they have gotten them sorted out...

Reviews.Title: Super Tablet!
Reviews.Author: Jules C
Reviews.Content: Great tablet and great price. Graphics are clear and bright. Works great for apps, internet...just about everything! Highly recommend to all users!

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: TR
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect - timely delivery, works fine. I wish it has backside camera too. Additionally I bought B Male to A Female adapter, which is on the picture, but doesn't included.

Reviews.Title: it is cool
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: it is a grate device grate graphics but this one was a bit to lacking in space for me . but as soon as i bought this one they came out with the 32gb version . well my lost . i sold it, so now i am waiting for one that has data and micro sd

Reviews.Title: i love it
Reviews.Author: clifford Noel
Reviews.Content: The google nexus is the coolest machine on the market. It rocks it arrived on time, and it meets my needs totally.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING speed and so beautiful
Reviews.Author: Karen "Vannessa"
Reviews.Content: Best tablet I have seen thus far. I would love it if it came with the Microsoft office pack version 2010 or newer.

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: mert23
Reviews.Content: Got this last December and am very impressed.  If you already have an android phone like me, it will automatically sync everything from your google account.  It doesn't have a cellular connection, but I don't miss this at all as I just tether it to my phone when I am out.  It has replaced both my laptop and my kindle, and after selling both those devices I actually made money on this purchase.  Pair it with a case with a stand and a bluetooth keyboard and it will do anything a laptop will do.  Don't know why the price is 249 on here when you can get it from google play for 199 though.

Reviews.Title: Nexus
Reviews.Author: Spenjm
Reviews.Content: My son gave the Google Nexus to me for my birthday. I have had it about six months now and I LOVE it. It is fantastic so portable easy to use integrated all of my stuff from laptop and my android phone. So it all synchronized and when I want to do something quick I use my tablet instead of my phone or laptop. I no longer play Angry Birds on my phone only on my tablet. It was difficult at first to acclimate because the motions are a bit different due to size difference and smaller hands but once I discovered how to achieve the same results as I had on my phone it was spectacular. I would highly recommend this device to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't be happier
Reviews.Author: Valen
Reviews.Content: I have used many 7 inch tablets but this one is by far the best one, its has everything you'd expect in a tablet. Its size is great, I can take it anywhere easily and its very user friendly

Reviews.Title: Amazing hardware flawed by a few OS issues
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: I got this Nexus 7 after having multiple Android smartphones over the past 4 years. Wow, it is like a whole different world being able to see things on a huge high-res screen, although I find the auto-brightness setting to err on being too dim.  The physical unit is great and well-made - the soft-touch back is especially expensive feeling.  This tablet is quite easy to use with one hand.  Performance is very good, but there have been a few hiccupps (i.e. stutters, freezes) beginning  after installing only one app.  Battery life is excellent; I can make it through two days of light/moderate use (I primarily use my laptop and desktop for heavy computing).  While it is nice to get updates directly from Google right when they are released, I have a couple issues with ICS & Jelly Bean, namely affecting power users. It's very confusing for a new owner to get into the developer mode. And, effective with ICS there's no task manager, something developers and tinkerers like.  However, those are items a normal user could probably care less about.  Overall, this is a great value and perfect for 95% of users out there.

Reviews.Title: The Best anywhere!
Reviews.Author: Scott Burkett "Radio news guy"
Reviews.Content: Having used the 10" tablets and several iPads, nothing beats the Nexus 7 tablet! Android Jelly Bean makes what is already a great piece, even that much better. The display and the ease of use definitely beats anything else I've experienced in the under-$500 class.Should Google decide to produce this tablet in 32 gb or 64 gb, it would definitely be my single media device.

Reviews.Title: The best
Reviews.Author: Edgar Walls
Reviews.Content: Better than any other tablet its size. Good price, a shame it doesnt have the Expanded Memory feature (SD card slot). Otherwise excellent.

Reviews.Title: returned it but i love the nexus 7
Reviews.Author: amarys
Reviews.Content: i personally already had a nexus tablet and was buying it for someone else. i returned it but i totally give it 5 stars. mine is wonderful and i take it everywhere

Reviews.Title: nexus 7
Reviews.Author: bluewolf
Reviews.Content: So great! But I really wish it had an SD slot! Besides for that it's great!!! Very clear screen. Got it for my wife and she just loves it! Can't say enough good about it!!

Reviews.Title: quick pickup of wifi signals. excellent value
Reviews.Author: numina
Reviews.Content: all around a terrific tablet for all of my general needs.the size, speed, capabilities and ease of use all make this device worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: Nexus tablet
Reviews.Author: Barrington  T Johnson
Reviews.Content: Loved it very handy tool. Great companion for travel. Not as restrictive as the Ipad. Great battery life and lightweight.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic product
Reviews.Author: hereisthiswoman
Reviews.Content: I love my tablet! Google did a fantastic job. Previously, I used my iPhone to do all my tablet-related stuff (web surfing, reading, playing games). No more eye strain or pecking the screen (hello, swyping)! Playing Super Nintendo games are awesome (can't do on iPhone). No lag in the system, even with multiple heavy apps up. Quick to respond. GREAT product at a steal! HIGHLY recommend!

Reviews.Title: Good but issues
Reviews.Author: JPG
Reviews.Content: great device. Has some issues.the speaker is horrible.even with a downloaded booster app you can barely hear it. really bad sound.The camera is a joke. There is no back camera. How do you line up a picture?but overall we enjoy the device. And for the price it's not bad.

Reviews.Title: Excellent. It was what I needed!!
Reviews.Author: Doris M. Brea
Reviews.Content: Yes, I recommended this tablet. It is very handled, because is thing and small! The relation price versus feature is incredible!!

Reviews.Title: Nexus tablet
Reviews.Author: Jude
Reviews.Content: I was told about this tablet from a co-worker and she love it. I like the idea that you can talk to put into the tablet.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy
Reviews.Author: Noah Vosler
Reviews.Content: Great Tablet. However Jelly Bean no longer supports Flash. Also there is no away facing camera. Overall a great value if those are not a problem for you.

Reviews.Title: gerat tablet
Reviews.Author: marc
Reviews.Content: i bought this for my wife as a gift. she fell in love with it right away. it has everything you need right at your fingertips. she has a phone that is an android, so this was very easy for her to understand.tablet is fast and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Overall Pleased
Reviews.Author: Javon Curry
Reviews.Content: Although the memory is only internal, this is a pretty decent tablet. It does what I need it to do and that's all that matters.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: It has not disappointed me in any way so far.Hardly put it down. Does everything you want on a tablet.

Reviews.Title: A versatile Tablet
Reviews.Author: VIRGILIO REGUDO JR.
Reviews.Content: Advance O.S. ( Jelly Bean 4.1 ) wow it's great tablet to own better than Samsung Tablet recommend to own one .

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Cori
Reviews.Content: Simply love it. Not much more to say- it was a toss up between this and the ipad mini, and I made the right choice for me. It's exactly what I needed.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Sara Taha
Reviews.Content: i bought this because itnis cheaper than an ipad and does more than it besides having a back facing camera i love this! it is small and comfortable to hold. the back is very nice and is rubbery and doesnt slip if i put it on glossy materiaks. the screen is not too stury as in yhe sense i wouldnt drop it because this isnt apple. i love this device and wouldnt change too much about it to be the perfect tablet. what i can say is all i wouls do is make the hardware a bit more sturdy and add a camera. buyt this tablet will not be getting returned its probably better than any kind of kindle and 16 gb is fine because i barely even use 8 gb of it

Reviews.Title: Great price, works perfectly
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Love this tablet, it's super fast online and really easy to set up and use.  It was a great price and shipped quickly.  I would use the store again.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Hombre satisfecho...
Reviews.Content: My google tablet is great as I have not that typing, just say what I want and what type tablet all, I like the good reproduction of the videos and quick web search.

Reviews.Title: Great little portable tablet.
Reviews.Author: James Mac
Reviews.Content: First I am going to get right to the bad since this will be short. Some of you have already read that this device has no external memory slot, no HDMI port and no cellular connection. So if your intent is a device so you can constantly surf the web than this is not the device for you. By design you can tell that Google wants you tie the user to their services as you won't be able to read memory from external devices. That is until you install Nexus Media Importer app. Still my only complaint is that whoever decided to not put in a HDMI port or a Micro SD slot should be fired. What I really can't understand is why Google opt for no HDMI port? Since you are almost tied to the movies on the Google play site. An HDMI port would increase their online movie sales from anyone who travels a lot and doesn't want to pack a laptop or large tablet like the ASUS Transformer Prime TF201-B1-CG 10.1-Inch 32GB Tablet (Champagne) That I also own. I personally don't intend to buy many movies since they would be UN-viewable without a WiFi connection. So for traveling purposes I will keep downloading my movies on the ASUS Prime. Still I did purchase 2 movies just to test the quality of the screen and my WIFI streaming. I watch Green Hornet and Transformers 3 and the screen resolution looks great and battery life is on this device is great but another downgrade as it does drain a little faster when playing games. As a photographer I bought the Nexus 7 because of it's size. The device works great with the Nikon wireless mobile adapter utility app and allows me a much larger screen for viewing raw shots after shooting when I am near a WiFi source keeping my photos off the web. The photos I do upload on Google's Picasa website or photobucket allows me a cloud type site to show potential clients my work on a screen much larger than my smart phone. I pre-ordered the 16 GB version directly from Google Play and I love using it around the house or at the studio. I have also downloaded several apps to use when I am away from the house that do not require WiFi. The touchscreen is very responsive, the system is extremely fast and I've only experience lag time once while playing the Need For Speed app.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet Choice
Reviews.Author: Christina
Reviews.Content: I looked at many of the tablets on the market and decided on this one mostly based on it's use of the android market (google play). I absolutely love it. Though I did not get a manual with it, the time it took for me to figure it out was minimal. It works and functions almost exactly like my smartphone, just a bigger screen.

Reviews.Title: Happy Camper
Reviews.Author: gordon Young
Reviews.Content: Arrived quickly and was fine upon arrival!  PAcking was in tact.  Nexus was fully operational upon receipt and started up quickly

Reviews.Title: Good quality product
Reviews.Author: M. Eguchi
Reviews.Content: It comes with two sheets (if I remember correctly) and save you some money for replacing it for new one once the first sheet gets some scratches or if you get a new tablet. I've been using it for a month or so and I dont see any scratches so far. Easy to use. I recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: Love this device!
Reviews.Author: J. Setliff
Reviews.Content: I love the Nexus 7.  It's my first tablet, and I currently have a Galaxy Nexus, and a Google TV, (plus a Chromebook).  I am able to sync my bookmarks, search history, across all of these devices.  Plus, the Nexus 7 is the best size for a tablet at 7".  Anything that needs a larger screen, I'll use my Chromebook.  Plus, the Google Play store has everything I need, from apps, to movies/tv and music, and now books and magazines!

Reviews.Title: LOVE
Reviews.Author: Mkh6942 "Me"
Reviews.Content: My daughter LOVES this. She is pretty much the techy of the family and says this is the best android tablet out there. Yes I would recommend purchasing this.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Derica Ellzey "Derz"
Reviews.Content: I bought mine slightly used but the tablet works great. I am very happy for my purchase. It runs fast, battery lasts quite a while. Only downside is hulu does not play on it :(

Reviews.Title: Good small tablet
Reviews.Author: SteelerFan4Life
Reviews.Content: Just got mine about a week ago and really like it. The size is perfect for work and the screen quality is great. Biggest issue I've seen is not as much available in terms of apps and books as Apple. Otherwise, I really like it.

Reviews.Title: Google Nexus 7 Tablet - excellent device
Reviews.Author: J. G. White
Reviews.Content: The Google Nexus 7 tablet is an excellent device.  It performs the functions of an e-reader very well.  Also it allows me to check email easily, and has access to the Google Play Store which has a large selection of apps, music, books, magazines and movies.  It does not have mobile web access, however.  A WiFi hotspot is needed to get to the web.  So far, this is only a slight inconvenience and the only downside to the device I have encountered.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Bruno Ideriha "Bruno"
Reviews.Content: What a great product! The only regret I have is not buying the 32Gb version. Was released the day I bought it. The OS is smooth, better than the Samsung's customized I have on my Galaxy SII. Absolutely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: An amazing tablet for the right price!
Reviews.Author: SpectralAngel
Reviews.Content: I can not really describe how excellent this tablet is! My family actually fights over it.It is very fast, stylish, and the form factor is spot on. My mother uses it as a media player during the mornings, my brother uses it for gamming and my sister uses it for chatting, now if they would let me use it, it would have been perfect.

Reviews.Title: Working great.
Reviews.Author: Tan
Reviews.Content: The packaging is in great condition and all items are there. I am very happy with it but may need to root it if I want special features. :)

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: a.snider
Reviews.Content: Wish It had a SD slot. Have not had any problems with it. Perfect size to carry everywhere with no hassle.

Reviews.Title: Great product at great price !
Reviews.Author: Ajay
Reviews.Content: This will be my 2nd Nexus 7 purchase of this year :)This is a great tablet for almost all activities - reading, playing games, emails, movies, you name it !

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected!
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: I am the recent owner of an Apple Ipod touch 4th gen. I really enjoyed my experience with the Ipod but it was lacking in many areas so I went looking for another product. I saw the Google Nexus 7 and, after several weeks of indecision, I made the buy. Wow! I love everything about it! I payed the low low price of $199 and it was well worth it! I love the GPS capabilities as well as the Google Maps! I can just save the maps for where I am going and works like a charm! The screen is huge and the access to several browsers makes surfing the web a snap! I would encourage everyone who is turned off by the steep prices of Apple to get this tablet! It is a STEAL!!!

Reviews.Title: Great device!
Reviews.Author: Anton Koval
Reviews.Content: Has a long life time on battery, perfect screen and quite good performance! Android is still having several annoying things - but with every release it becomes better and better.

Reviews.Title: very nice size. fast, compact great for on the go.
Reviews.Author: mark gerdes "amercasa"
Reviews.Content: great toy. my son is getting a case with keyboard and i think it will make a great combo and make this quite the practical item to carry around. a guy finds himself having to connect every time he turns around these days. with the wifi's around there is not much trouble in getting the job done. this does not have 3g but i do not want nor would like to be paying the price for 3 or 4g.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: This is a very good tablet, the quality is really great for a price of $200. HD screen, quad core processor, 1GB of RAM, the list goes on. This tablet should be priced at $299, but google is pretty cool. With android 4.2 on the tablet you have the freedom to do a lot of things and everything is very accessible, the procossor is standard at 1.3GHz but it still seems blazing fast, you can root it and overclock the processor to 1.8GHz if you wanted to. Anyway, it is great for social media apps, skypeing/video chatting, watching youtube videos, it is the ultimate entertainment tablet. The only problem that i have with it is that there was no light included to indicate when the tablet was done charging. Other then that i couldn't be happier, it doesn't get too toasty, the battery life is long, very slim and portable, and overall a great tablet. The only other thing i can say is if you plan on buying it online buy the tablet from google play, its $225 out the door with shipping.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: Kelly D
Reviews.Content: I spent hours reviewing different tablets to get as a gift for my sister. This one got the better reviews based on product quality, screen resolution, processing speed, and price. My sister loves it! She's not very tech-savvy but she easily got the hang of it with a few coaching tips and youtube tutorials.  I definitely recommend this tablet!

Reviews.Title: Love the Android OS
Reviews.Author: Gary
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my 12 year old niece. She really loves it. I am used to an iPad so it seemed a little small at first but I love the greater flexibility/control over the OS that Apple refuses to allow. Perfect example is the ability to not only see what is draining your batter but also being able to close applications.

Reviews.Title: Great Tablet
Reviews.Author: decker brower
Reviews.Content: Awesome product. I love the size its not too big or bulky but not so small that it feels like holding a phone. couldnt be happier with it.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: M. Davis
Reviews.Content: Works great and as advertised. Bought as a gift and it was well received. No problems getting it to work right out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Great little tab!!
Reviews.Author: believer in magic and miracles
Reviews.Content: I an older and technology is so not my thing.  I love this little device. There is a learning curve but not hard.  I am having a ball-good reviews and low price sold me and I would recommend it highly.:-) :-) :-)

Reviews.Title: My Nexus 7 tablet... Google rocks!
Reviews.Author: Sharan
Reviews.Content: A must have product from google..nexus 7 is too good...i bought this tablet a few months ago...its awesome...Amazon on the other hand did a great job in getting this product to me on time...i am very much impressed from Amazon and their delivery timeliness..overall i am satisfied with this tablet...Google and Amazon.com rocks!Cheers!Sharan

Reviews.Title: Enjoyable Product, Great unit.
Reviews.Author: Michael E. Califfsr
Reviews.Content: got this unit while vacationing with my Brother. It turned out to be one of the featured products of the trip. It's Android OS is quite adequate for all situations and ease of use is much desired.I would definitely buy another.

Reviews.Title: its amazing
Reviews.Author: o shalabi
Reviews.Content: its amazing, i use the powerful GPS in my engineering work, and i find it helpful to my work especially google earth and the off line google earththanks

Reviews.Title: Great device!
Reviews.Author: Winterborne
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed it initially and I just keep finding uses for it. Great fit for my hand size and even fits in my back jeans pocket.

Reviews.Title: Nice Little Powerhouse
Reviews.Author: Justin S. Budrow
Reviews.Content: Best 7 inch tablet on the market. Period.ASUS makes their products represent the gold standard. This is a huge leap forward.The best specs I appreciate on this tablet: Tegra 3 processor, Android 4.1 jelly bean, and screen quality. I don't use the tablet all the time, but I still like using it for gaming.

Reviews.Title: Good but not perfect
Reviews.Author: Franck Dernoncourt
Reviews.Content: Pretty good but some annoying weaknesses:* no dual band Wi-Fi (i.e. no Wi-Fi N 5GHz)* no slot for additional memory (SD card)* no connection port for external display (e.g. projector)

Reviews.Title: AMAZING TABLET!
Reviews.Author: Khaled Mohammed
Reviews.Content: The Google Nexus 7 is an amazing tablet to buy. As a resident in the Middle East, i find it quick and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: outstanding
Reviews.Author: hurricanebrasilia
Reviews.Content: for me is one of the best products launched, fast, very very fast, good resolution the best relation cost x benefit...

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: juan
Reviews.Content: Fast with great screen resolution. Love the size, you can hold it with one hand easely, ideal for read news magazzines etc.games runs smooth, and you can attach all kinds of USB controllers, drives, cameras- sony nex 5, you ll need a otg USB cable forma that

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!! It's like a new tablet everytime I pick it up!!
Reviews.Author: ButcherChop
Reviews.Content: I really love this tablet. Its responsive and quick, the UI is far superior to tablets of old. Google Play (Android Market) has also come a very long way. Its fun to go into the Apps section to browse the apps. The screen resolution is excellent and I watch movies on it all the time. I didnt have time to watch True Blood on TV so I loaded it onto my tablet and watched it while I was out running errands and appointments. Google Play offers tons of movies and Netflix works great!! My Android phone provides me with a FREE WiFI Hotspot so Im online when I need to be. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT!

Reviews.Title: A 7inch that makes sense
Reviews.Author: steven y "Steven Y"
Reviews.Content: What is there to say?Zippycomfortable to holdgreat screenI think people are too busy nitpicking on things just to complain, I get it, that is what the net does, it allows people to complain behind a computer screen. But i really enjoy this tablet for what it does..I surf the net and the Tegra 3 does it efficiently, I read my books and the screen is lit perfectly, I wanted something comfortable to hold and it does that pretty good too.Buy with confidence.

Reviews.Title: Great Device
Reviews.Author: Han91957
Reviews.Content: I have used many tablets, the Nexus is the best of them all. Easy to use, great resolution, and many apps to choose from.

Reviews.Title: Amazing device!
Reviews.Author: Deevs Venegas
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet, and just love it to bits! I guess everybody else had shared my sentiments already but all I can say is this device is most reliable and caters to my needs well. I now use this device more than my iPhone 4 and has never failed me. Clearly my best electronic purchase to date!

Reviews.Title: Breaks way too easily
Reviews.Author: Sam Wilson
Reviews.Content: I had this for a littlie while and enjoyed it, up until the very first time it fell.  A very short fall of almost no distance at all, and had a couple chunks of screen break off, and what's left of the screen is completely unresponsive.  Additionally, to get it fixed costs nearly the price of a completely new device. Checking online it seems other people have had the same issue and believe it's the result of possibly not being manufactured quite right.

Reviews.Title: nexus 7
Reviews.Author: joe
Reviews.Content: This tablet exceeded my expectations in terms of use and the endless possibilities. I only had 1 problem with the tablet I drop the tablet twice And uppn dropping it the second time the screen shattered and now is not usable, it could be a rare fluke incident because I thought it had gorilla glass but who knows I do intend to try and fix the tablet my self since besides the cracked screen it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: Nexus 7 Issues
Reviews.Author: Nisim Heletz
Reviews.Content: Update: 11/16/2012My Nexus 7 device was repaired at a cost of $105 (after some talks with Asus).They replaced the broken screen and shipped it back free of charge. It took a while to get it back, but the repair was done well and device and screen are in new condition.I have been working with the device again during the past few days and there are no other issues. They did re-install the OS which I knew they probably would.I am upping my  review to 4 starts, it is really 3.5 starts though because the device should be designed to withstand light drops.----I purchased this device 3 months ago from Google's site shortly after it launched.Overall this is a good product and fun to use. Jelly Bean has come a long way with responsiveness and user experience.However, there are several significant issues with the device:Issue #1: The glass is thin and it breaks with even the lightest of bumps. The device slid from my lap when sitting on a sofa down to the carpeted floor. You couldn't have guessed it - yes, the screen was cracked when I picked it up. To think how many times I have dropped iphones, ipads etc over the years, if they all cracked that easily then I would either have to spend thousands of dollars on replacements, or more likely stop using mobile devices altogether. I called Google Nexus support and described what happened in detail. Support rep was nice but said "it is an out of warranty issue". Sent me to Asus customer support. The service rep over there not nearly as nice but I explained what happened and that it should be taken care of under warranty because a mobile device should be designed to absorb light falls and bumps. I will update on this as I am sending the device to them for examination.Issue #2: Wifi wake up. I expected wifi to come on the moment I wake up the device. This is the case with all the mobile devices I have used in recent years. The Nexus 7 takes a good 5 - 10 second to start the Wifi when I wake it up. It's been an issue from day 1 and this happens every time I wake it up, so need to watch the wifi icon and wait a bit...Issue #3: Get's sluggish fairly quickly. We all remember the experience when using computes running Windows right? We restart the computer on average once a day and everything seems to be running pretty quick for a while, until the next restart is due. This device / os has the same issue. It trained me to restart it once a day at least to get good performance. This may get better with OS patches or upgrades.There are many other minor issues with this device / os but which device doesn't have them? I think the ones listed above really hurt the device so I wanted to point those out. Overall I would still buy the device considering it's low price to value ratio but would have liked to know the issues and especially the issue with its super fragile glass.

Reviews.Title: Google nexus 7 16gb
Reviews.Author: Christopher R. Santini
Reviews.Content: This tablet has exceeded my expectations ten fold. I wanted an ipad and got this because of the price,but I'm very happy I went this route. I wanted the ipad initially because I have a mac book, Iphone and several apple products but I got a good deal on the nexus. It is fast and customizable it also works well with my Mac for transfers. I'm delighted with the purchase. My brother was going to buy a Kindle fire and I had to tell him to rethink that decision.

Reviews.Title: Highly portable Ebook Reader
Reviews.Author: Parker Hallam
